characters: WALLS ON BOTH SIDES OF THE TOWER ARE COMPLETELY GONE,
GARZA AND MONROE ON THE BALCONY
STORY HIGH TOWER THAT IS THE GENERAL'S LIVING QUARTERS. T
SERIES OF SHOTS OF CORZAN LIFE
THE ONLY SECTION THAT REMAINS STANDING IS THE NARROW SEVE
FLOW BATTLE. TO DESCRIBE THE ACTION DESIGNED FOR THIS SCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MOONLIGHT reflects off the calm dark body of water. W in the distance FAINT LIGHTS on shore indicate a hint of PIRATE LAIR known as HARARDHERE. The outline of an anchor 25,000 ton CARGO SHIP (THE CHEMSTAR) is barely discernibl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 25 FOOT POWER BOAT pulls along side the ship and TEN AR PIRATES aggressively scramble up several HANGING ROPE LADDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy DOOR to a large unit STORAGE ROOM swings open revealing the kidnapped crew. They are thoroughly exhaust and suffering from dehydration. The SOMALIAN PIRATES charge into the room and loudly orde the men to their feet. Some manage to rise and the ones t are too weak to comply are savagely kicked and jerked upr by KNOTTED ROPES that are wrapped around their necks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: SHIP’S STAIRCASE The DARK METAL STAIRCASE reverberates loudly as the BOUND HOSTAGES are kicked and shoved down toward the bowels of ship.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. -— SHIP The only sound heard is the LAPPING WAVES that strike the ship’s side. The TETHERED PIRATES’ BOAT is seen in the foreground as a BLACK MILITARY ZODIAC silently drifts int view. On board the outline of FIVE MEN clad in DARK BATTL ATTIRE is seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUND HOSTAGES are being shoved and kicked into the center of the ship’s HOLD. High above the HOLD are open C DOORS that reveal the dark night sky. TWO PIRATES stand g above the ‘HOLD’ watching the HOSTAGES being abused below

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S HOLD
dialogues.text: The HOSTAGES are being dragged into the center of the MET CARGO AREA. The PIRATES mock their pleas for ‘help’ and t burning CIGARETTES at them. Several of the PIRATES pass around large joints of MARIJUANA.

dialogues.speaker: SHIPS UPPER DECK
dialogues.text: Extreme CLOSE UP into the LENS of the newest installment NIGHT VISION GOGGLES. The individual wearing them is not clearly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOMALIAN PIRATE leans against the ship’s railing while having a CIGARETTE. The NIGHT VISION then pans to a secon PIRATE drinking a BOTTLE OF BEER while keeping ‘lookout’ the next DECK up. The NIGHT VISION pans down to a PIRATE seated on the edge the cargo hold observing the “HOSTAGE INTIMIDATION” actio that’s transpiring below.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S HOLD
dialogues.text: The PIRATE LEADER bellows orders and the PIRATE CREW kick HOSTAGES to their knees, while dragging them into a strai line. The LEADER orders another PIRATE holding a small VI CAMERA to begin filming. The LEADER paces behind the doomed HOSTAGES.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Somali) We had these men too long! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LEADER (cont'd) Now someone has to pay. The company had time to pay! Three million! But you pay nothing yet - If you do not care, we do not care! (to another pirate) Hold out that one’s hand!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PIRATE grabs the closest HOSTAGE and pulls his bound ha upward.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S DECK
dialogues.text: The NIGHT VISION IMAGE moves forward until it’s inches aw from the SMOKING PIRATE leaning against the railing. The PIRATES eyes bulge as a KNIFE is driven into his back. WIDE SHOT - An outlined image of a BLACK CLAD MERCENARY heaving the DEAD PIRATE over the railing.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S HOLD
dialogues.text: The GAGGED HOSTAGE’S muffled cries for mercy fall on deaf ears. The PIRATE LEADER is playing to the PORTABLE CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: A worker needs his hands! But you people don’t pay! Does that mean you don’t need this man anymore?

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S DECK
dialogues.text: The GREEN NIGHT VISION HUE pans around and settles on the PIRATE on the SECOND DECK, which is thirty yards away. We the PIRATE pass to the ship’s super structure and a very FIGURE clad in BLACK seizes him by the neck and easily sn it. The NIGHT VISION POV swings to the PIRATE sitting on the of the CARGO HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. -— CARGO HOLD The PIRATE LEADER has stepped in front of the cowering HOSTAGE. His temper is beyond the boiling point.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (to camera) We have nothin’, we want what others have, you have, all you devils have!! You will now pay or their blood is on you! You!! - Hold up his hands! The LEADER takes a huge MACHETE from another PIRATE. Glowering at the HOSTAGE, he raises the BLADE to chop off man’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. —- SHIP’S DECK The PIRATE sitting on the edge of the ship’s HOLD is sudd enveloped in the GREEN HUE of the NIGHT VISION GOGGLES. T BULLETS explode into his back, thus catapulting him over edge.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S HOLD
dialogues.text: The MACHETE is about to descend when the GUNFIRE startles present. Snapping their attention upward, they see the riddled PIRATE'S BODY crash heavily against the HOLD‘S st floor. The PIRATE with the PORTABLE CAMERA pans upward as GUNFIR erupts from above. While dashing for shelter, some of thi event will be haphazardly recorded and used in a later sc The PIRATES regain their senses and fire upward through t CARGO HOLD OPENING. Instantly TWO M-18 colored SMOKE GREN are tossed from above. The Room is instantly enveloped in billowing hell. HOSTAGES run and crawl in every direction seeking safety. TWO MERCENARIES (HALE CAESAR, African American and KONG K Chinese) repel down a pair of ROPE tossed over the CARGO HOLD’S edge. A THIRD and FORTH MERCENARY who are LEE CHRISTMAS and te leader BARNEY ROSS, lay down cover fire killing TWO MORE PIRATES then quickly repel over the side into the thicken smoke.

dialogues.speaker: STAIRWELL
dialogues.text: TWO MORE PIRATES attempt to flee up the steel steps and a blasted back by a FIFTH MERCENARY charging towards them. is GUNNAR JENSEN, a large, instable, old school MERCENARY lives for these violent encounters. He like all the other MERCENARIES has a TATTOO on his FOREARM. It’s a RAVEN per on a SKULL around which is the word EXPENDABLES.

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCENARIES
dialogues.text: HALE CAESAR and KONG KAO move stealthily through the blin smoke, which now begins curling through the CARGO OPENING above.

dialogues.speaker: KONG KAO
dialogues.text: leaps out of the haze and catches a PIRATE off guard and crushes him with a savage kick and a finishing blow with fist.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Heaves his KNIFE at a PIRATE who is firing randomly in th fading haze.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY ROSS
dialogues.text: slides from behind a STACK OF CARGO CRATES and slips a GA around another PIRATE’S neck, slamming him headlong into ship’s hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blows a PIRATE away with his FORTY FIVE, but is shot in t chest by the PIRATE LEADER. Luckily his life is spared by protective VEST. Dropping to one knee, he returns fire bu the PIRATE LEADER is gone.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Chases a FLEEING PIRATE up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Shoots another ARMED PIRATE who has been cornered.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: kills a PIRATE who is about to fire on the helpless HOSTA with a MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: On deck chases the FLEEING PIRATE out of the staircase opening. Suddenly pivoting, the PIRATE whips around and empties the remainder of his clip. KONG slips behind a ME STRUCTURE, then charges out after the PIRATE who leaps ov the railing and begins to descend the ROPE LADDER.

dialogues.speaker: SHIP'S DECK
dialogues.text: Thoroughly enraged, GUNNAR drags the PIRATE LEADER out by throat. The PIRATE’S FACE has taken a pounding.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SHIP’S HOLD Though having been dropped by one of the PIRATES, the PORTABLE VIDEO CAMERA is still functioning. The haze has cleared. HALE CAESAR, BARNEY, and CHRISTMAS secured the area.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (to hostages) This all of you? CHRISTMAS’ attention is drawn upward. Overhead is GUNNAR, wrapping the repelling rope around the semi-conscious PIR LEADER'S neck.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’s he doing!? BARNEY snaps his head toward the HOLD ENTRANCE high above them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Hey! GUNNAR ignores him while continuing to wrap the repelling rope around the PIRATE LEADER’S neck.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: He’s out of it!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Gunnar!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. - SHIP’S DECK - NIGHT KONG has dispatched his PIRATE and from twenty yards away make out the FAINT OUTLINE of GUNNAR and the doomed PIRAT LEADER.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: are riveted on GUNNAR.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let ‘em go! It’s over!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Not yet. Not quite.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We shoulda shot ‘im last year. GUNNAR yanks the PIRATE upright and turns him face forwar like a man on a gallows.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (loudly declares) For committing the crime at sea, pirates are hung! Everybody knows that!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let ‘im go!!

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Just doing what the law won't! GUNNAR tenses his grip on the PIRATE as he prepares to sh him over the CARGO HOLD LEDGE. At the last possible secon GUNNAR is blind-sided by a arcing KICK from KONG that nea drops him to his knees. GUNNAR’S eyes fill with rage and tosses the PIRATE aside.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: observe what just transpired and rush toward the staircas

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Attacks KONG who lands a crushing KICK to the knee and an ELBOW to the eye that splits the big man’s BROW open. With startling speed, GUNNAR turns the tables by parrying KONG’S next blow, then seizing him by the throat, smashes to the ground. Instantly there’s a COMBAT KNIFE pressed against KONG’S throat. BLOOD streams along the side of GUNNAR’S face.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: What were you thinkin’? As GUNNAR presses the KNIFE against KONG’S throat, a PIST is jammed against the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coolly) That you, Barney?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah - Back off, Gunnar. GUNNAR holds fast. He touches the BLOOD from the wound.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: I’1l need stitches.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Could be - Let ‘im go.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Sure, after I kill this chink - Wanna watch? CHRISTMAS pulls back the hammer on his PISTOL. Suddenly KONG slams a knee into GUNNAR’S GROIN and sweeps razor sharp BLADE away from his throat, then leaps to his feet. GUNNAR prepares to likewise leap to his feet, only to fin BARNEY jamming a PISTOL BARREL under his chin.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (smiles) Back again?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: His brain’s cooked. BARNEY reaches into GUNNAR’S pocket and pulls out a SMALL PLASTIC CELLOPHANE POUCH of METH.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: -..Bad habit.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No more chances - You're done.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: How about if I clean up?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: I know.  10. GUNNAR almost gently removes the BAG of METH from BARNEY' hand.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (mock surprise) For the trip home - Hey, old friend, let me up I won’t hurt anyone - Wait! That’s not true, I‘1l kill everyone. (gestures towards Kong) Especially Mighty Mouse. GUNNAR gestures to CHRISTMAS, who is dying to take anothe crack at the big man.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Better tie me up, Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Do it. CHRISTMAS steps forward to put on the PLASTIC HAND CUFFS. this moment the PIRATE LEADER begins to regain consciousn and weakly removes the ROPE from around his neck. GUNNAR’S eyes shift over to the PIRATE LEADER and with a slight expression of bemusement, snaps out his LEG catchi the degenerate PIRATE flush, thus sending him over the ed of the CARGO HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Couldn’t resist.

dialogues.speaker: A DARK SCREEN.
dialogues.text: We hear the formal, cut and dry, sardonic voice of AGENT DIANE LICKSON. Now appearing on the darkened screen is basically the pri scene only now filmed with a cheap video camera in a very AMATEURISH fashion.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This rough footage was taken by one of the kidnappers who didn’t manage to survive. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT LICKSON (V.0.) (cont'd) The private contractors seen here are believed to be Americans according to the rescued French crew.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: The SHIP’S CAPTIVES kneel in the foreground, the ARMED PIRATES behind them. The LEADER speaks directly at the ca while clutching a MACHETE.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What you see is pretty self- explanatory. The leader's threatening to dismember one of the hostages if his demands are not met, how original - The LEADER leans forward to cut off a HOSTAGE’S hands. Suddenly GUNFIRE from above and a DEAD PIRATE drops into view. Now the footage becomes FRENZIED as the ‘video cam’ pans upwards catching a glimpse of the MERCENARIES who fire at PIRATES below. The ‘video cam’ is dropped to the ground a lies at an ODD ANGLE while continuing to roll. PANIC! Smoke GRENADES explode! PIRATES fire their WEAPONS the direction of the assault. MORE BULLETS, screams! CURSES! The CARGO AREA fills up with SMOKE.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: Fast Forward please - The TAPE speeds along until the SMOKE begins to disperse. Stepping into view is BARNEY ROSS. We hear his voice, but because of the cavernous cargo hold, it is not very disti

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...-Let him go! We’re done here! GUNNAR’S voice is heard OFF SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let him go!  12.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: He hangs! This is when KONG attacks GUNNAR and BARNEY starts to run of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: Freeze it! (dryly) Now that’s entertainment - A THIRTY FOUR YEAR OLD FEMALE AGENT named DIANE LICKSON removes her GLASSES and faces SEVEN FELLOW AGENTS approximately the same age, seated around a boardroom TAB The lights still remain dimmed.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: Even though the Hostages were French Nationals, we believe the Marseille shipping company hired American mercenaries to do the job - And therein lies the problem. She faces the unclear IMAGE of BARNEY on screen.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: With local governments unable to stop piracy flaring up along the coast of Kuala Lumpur, Nigeria, and of course the hell hole of the moment, Somalia, there’s no shortage of employment for mercenaries willing to go to these places. LICKSON begins to pace in front of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: Well, for this country the ‘wet work’ is about to end thanks to the new U.N. Mandate declaring all American contractors engaging in violent clandestine operations on foreign soil will cease and desist, and if caught in violation, will face serious prison time. Since this operation led to twelve upstanding Somalian pirates being permanently dispatched, this group of mercenaries here will be at the forefront of our investigation. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AGENT LICKSON (cont'd) We've already run the ‘facial recognition program,’ but because of the tape’s poor quality, none of the men have been positively identified as of yet - So just stay on it. AGENT WILL (WILLY) SANDS, (50) is an ‘out of the box’ thinker, who’s always been at odds with the establishment mainly because he has a heart. Simply put, he’s CONFLICTE His eyes are RIVETED to the image of BARNEY ROSS. His min churns.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: Senior Agent Sands will oversee this investigation, so all reports should go directly to his desk first - Thank you. The SEVEN AGENTS rise to exit. They glance at WILL then a one another. WILL is an unknown relic to them. LICKSON approaches WILL, who continues to stare at the im of BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Bringing me on board.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT LICKSON
dialogues.text: It’s been what, seven years since you’ve been out in the ‘field?’ When this assignment crossed my desk, I thought of you - Why wouldn’t I? You’ve helped me when I first got here - Call it even.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (gestures to the screen) .--This guy cost me a lot.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: I know the history - (gestures to the screen) So you think it’s him? WILL rises beside LICKSON.  14.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (nods ) Yes - His name is Ross -

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Well they’ve been lucky or smart because there’s been no reports on their activities for three years. They both head to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Time to pick up where you left off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS pulls up on a beautiful HARLEY DAVIDSON ‘Night Rider’ and dismounts. He removes a BOTTLE of high end CHAMPAGNE tucked in his jacket and approaches the buildin

dialogues.speaker: STAIRCASE
dialogues.text: With a sense of purpose CHRISTMAS bounds off of the stair and strolling along the balcony, arrives at a familiar do He removes a SMALL BLACK RING BOX from his jacket and fli it open and studies the 3 CARAT RUBY RING. He knocks. A moment later he hears the familiar voice of his girlfri LACY.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (through door) Yes - Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (seductive and playful) ...-Christmas is here. There’s an unsettling pause.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Lee?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah -  15.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: .-.I didn’t expect you - I look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Hey, you never looked bad. LACY barely opens the door. She’s in her late 20's. She’s good soul, pleasantly attractive in a very natural way, a North Dakota transplant.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) You said you called? - I look terrible.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You look great to me and I left a message.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: That was three months ago.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Look what I found. He holds up the CHAMPAGNE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Rose flavored - So let me in so we can let the ‘welcome home’ celebration begin.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lace — In the background, a THIRTY-ISH, clean-cut MAN steps into view wearing pants and a white T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: ..-Everything good?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: (low) Yes...he’s a friend.

dialogues.speaker: VISITOR
dialogues.text: (at Christmas) Need anything?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: No, everything’s alright.  16. CHRISTMAS locks stares with the VISITOR. For a man who is natural fighting machine, the fight seems to drain from h body. Leaning against the railing, he almost gently place the BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE on the ground... LACY glances back at the VISITOR and gestures for him to off. LACY steps outside and stands directly behind the crestfallen man.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (softly) .-.I thought everything with us was good?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Maybe for you, Lee, you’re never around enough... You never really got into my life, you didn’t, not the way people who are serious about each other do - You just come and go, you’re never there when people need you - It gets lonely spending holidays by myself. I don’t mean to make you feel bad because deep down, I believe you’re a good guy, but time is moving, Lee, I need to make a life for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. CHRISTMAS digs deep into his pride.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - Y'know, maybe I’ve done a lot of things wrong - Maybe it’s payback for acting like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: You’re not a fool - It’s just the way you are.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: So we can get through this.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: It won’t work this time. LACY is locked in turmoil.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: A little talking can’t hurt?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How’d ya know till we give it a try?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: .--.-I’m pregnant. is crushed. His life force drained.

dialogues.speaker: LACY
dialogues.text: ...You were never around.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah - You're a good girl, Lace. (gestures to the champagne) If you don’t mind I’1l leave that. descends the steps and fades from view.

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: We see BARNEY entering the opulent establishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY crosses the lobby and approaches LEE CHRISTMAS. BARNEY arrives. CHRISTMAS snaps out of his pensive mood w he spots BARNEY. He removes his IPOD EARPHONES and gestur towards a pair of MEN seated in the BAR. As they move off BARNEY senses his friend’s dark mood.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Who died?  18.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We'll talk later -

dialogues.speaker: BAR
dialogues.text: One of the MEN seated in the well-appointed bar is MR. CHURCH. He’s 60 YRS OLD and corporate in appearance. The other MAN, who is seated a table AWAY, is physically GERM and in his LATE 40’s.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Mr. Church?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Yes. (rising) You’re not easy to contact, Mr. Ross. Care to sit? Mr. Church isn’t my real name, but you don’t need to know my name. Seated over there is my assistant, you don’t need to know his name either.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Alright - What do we need to know?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (eyeing Christmas) It’s alright to talk?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Go ahead - I don’t speak English.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Church) It’s alright. CHURCH reaches into his jacket and withdraws a PHOTO, whi he hands over to BARNEY. He looks at BARNEY’S FOREARM and eyes the ‘EXPENDABLES’ tattoo of the RAVEN on a SKULL. BARNEY eyes the photo. It is the image of a dead-eyed, po marked, MIDDLE-AGED HISPANIC man wearing a GENERAL’S MILI UNIFORM. He passes it to CHRISTMAS. KAREN, an attractive, RAVEN-HAIRED WAITRESS comes over.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (cheerfully) Hello, can I help you?  19.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Bookers neat.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Anything for you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (dully) Ah, three beers.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Three beers it is... The WAITRESS stares intently at CHRISTMAS who’s oblivious BARNEY notes this.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: Anything else? CHRISTMAS, still not looking at her, dully shakes his hea KAREN starts off. MR. CHURCH removes a PHOTO from his jacket pocket.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Now that’s a photo of - KAREN unexpectedly turns and returns to the table.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) You don’t remember me, do you? Karen? CHRISTMAS is perplexed. BARNEY sighs. He’s been through t many times before.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (struggling to stay composed) We went out about ten times.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You sure? KAREN holds up her hands. On one of her FINGERS is a smal but pretty BUTTERFLY RING.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: You gave me this, then you disappeared. I’m just curious, what did I do wrong?  20. Everyone present has become incredibly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How long ago was this?

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: ...Unbelievable - (to Group) Sorry but I’ve been waiting a long time to tell him off, but it’s not worth it. KAREN moves off.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where were we?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (handing over a photo) That’s a picture of General Ruben Garza, Leader of Corza, which is a small, barely developed island nation due east of Cuba. Church lays out a map of the region...

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) Ever heard of it? CHRISTMAS shakes his head ‘No.’

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Not many people have. Two years ago, General Garza overthrew the government and made himself Headman, and the island has been a human rights graveyard. Since Corza has nothing economically to offer, our government has never gotten involved and never will. Church slides another photo across the table, this one of SMILING YOUNG MAN in his early 20's.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: His name’s Bill Parker, my grandson, my daughter’s only son. He loved Corza and it’s people, and travelled there whenever he could, I guess hoping to make some sort of a ‘humanitarian’ difference.  21. Church passes over a final PHOTOGRAPH. The same YOUNG MAN. DEAD. Clothes torn to shreds, filth c across his pale body. He lies in a muddy DITCH, eyes near as wide as his exposed jugular.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: On his last visit, he was killed - The locals say Garza’s soldiers were responsible. This has visibly affected BARNEY. CHRISTMAS takes a look, his mind is elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Was he stirring people up?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: He wasn’t like that -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (distantly) - How’d you get this picture? The WAITRESS sets down the THREE BEERS for CHRISTMAS, who takes a long sip.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: I hired a private investigator who went to Corza, found his body, and took photos as proof of death. He couldn’t bring the remains home, without risking his own life - His mother’s taking this badly - Do you have a child? BARNEY studies the PHOTO.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I have a seaplane. (to Christmas who’s daydreaming) How’s the view from space?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (shedding the fog) How long was your grandson missing?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Least a week or more. CHRISTMAS slips back into silence.  22.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s it? CHRISTMAS nods ‘yes.’ KAREN the waitress arrives and sets down the DRINKS.

dialogues.speaker: KAREN
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Bookers for you - And three beers for the man who wastes your life. She moves off. BARNEY angrily eyes CHRISTMAS, who is trul embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So what do you need, Mr. Church?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: I want Garza assassinated - CHURCH stares straight into BARNEY'S eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: (barely holding it together) I want his palace destroyed, his government destroyed, his people to pay - You're probably thinking: ‘If Garza’s out, who will replace him?’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It crossed my mind.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: If he’s still alive, the ousted President, Miguel Fuentes, should be reinstated, and if he isn’t, then the people should choose who they want - Either way, they’re better off with Garza gone. BARNEY sips his drink and exchanges glances with CHRISTMA

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: You look skeptical - I understand, but from all the research I've done, the success rate of your operations has been very high and I’m ready to pay whatever it costs to get Garza back.  23.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s not just about money.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: With ‘mercenaries’ I thought it was only about the money.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s about one rule.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (simply) .+-They gotta deserve it. BARNEY picks up the PHOTO of GARZA and stares at it intensely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JEEP and a TEN WHEELER ARMY TRUCK grind past the MASSIV GATES and swing into the courtyard. The PALACE is old and solid, and has a forboding aura. La LIGHTS shine down from the BARBED WIRED walls that surrou this horrible structure. Standing on the PALACE steps is a very large AMERICAN OPERATIVE named, PAINE. Beside him, are TWO OTHER RAW-BON AMERICAN OPERATIVES. These MEN are basically professional killers. With dead eyes they watch the FOUR PEASANT PRISO thrown roughly off the rear of the truck. The pitiless SOLDIERS kick the helpless men into a single line. The FRONT DOOR to the PALACE opens and a PAIR OF GUARDS p into view followed by GENERAL GARZA. Short, PARANOID and withdrawn, he studies the men as if they were worthless insects, then nervously scans the surrounding area. His reptilian behavior has everyone on edge. All dialogue is SPANISH.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (calmly) You know why you’re here?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: .-+.We did nothing. Another PRISONER tries to object and is kicked by PAINE.  24.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: You’re still loyal to the old president, yes?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: Don’t lie. All of you are telling the truth?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONERS
dialogues.text: (together) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: ...Thank you. Emotionless, GARZA ‘pats’ one MAN’S head then takes a lar PISTOL from PAINE’S SHOULDER HOLSTER, and fires point bla into another PEASANT’S head.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (handing back the pistol) Not everybody tells the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY’S dark 1956 F-100 FORD PICK UP TRUCK is parked on Highway 75 directly across the base’s entrance. In the passenger seat is CHRISTMAS. Still in a pensive st he listens to his IPOD. The song ‘INTO THE NIGHT’ by Benn Mardones leaks out from his EARPHONES. BARNEY’S growing impatient as he observes CHRISTMAS, who' lost in thought. The overly dramatic music swells in intensity as it drifts from CHRISTMAS’ earphones. BARNEY taps his friend.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hey -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (mildly startled) What? They rise and walk away from earshot of the other men.  25.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It’s nothin’ - It’s my problem.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: When we’re workin,’ it’s my problem too.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: This one was bad. Why can’t I keep a relationship going? It’s starting to mess with my mind; seriously.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You pick the wrong women.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That’s not it, it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: How do you figure?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I’m a front runner - I start out strong, but I’m never there in the end - It’s like a bad habit.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So you feel worthless.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t say ‘worthless.’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: But you thought it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You love stickin’ it to me when I’m down.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No, when you're feeling sorry for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Who should I feel sorry for? This truck? I just need to forget about meeting a new woman for a while, just enjoy my own company.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s not you.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Seriously, don’t you think the guy who's probably gonna get along best with women, is probably the guy who can get along without ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: This talk’s been a waste of time. BARNEY notices something out of the corner of his eye. HULKING MARK approaches They both direct their eyes to a large uniformed FIRST LIEUTENANT NAVY SEAL approaching from the base’s entrance

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: How you doing, Chief?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Good, Captain - Thanks for your time, Mark.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: Hey, Christmas - (Christmas shrugs) Heard you guys dumped Gunnar Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Drug head.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No, the ‘life’ just got to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Didn’t get to us -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - Give it time.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: So what can I do for ya?  27.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We've gotta replace Gunnar - Ex- Seals are always a safe bet, so if you've got someone you’ve worked with closely, someone you've deployed on important operations -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - Someone you can friggin’ trust with your life -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Someone gay —

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Relax - Have a line on anybody who fits the bill?

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: There’s a guy who came over with an advanced team of Brazilian commandos that we then trained for South American counter insurgency deployment.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You personally trained them?

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: Yeah - This one guy, who’s the type you're looking for, quit the service an’ works here and there.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Can you run him down?

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: Probably - What’re you cooking up?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Can’t discuss it -

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: I respect that - Alright, if I find ‘im, I’1l send ‘im around. (moves off) CHRISTMAS faces BARNEY, who puts the TRUCK in gear and pu away.  28.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: A gay, bilingual mercenary - What are you writing a musical?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Can you keep your mouth closed?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s hear it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HALE CAESAR’S KILLER TACOS - NIGHT This is a colorful, two-story BAR and RESTAURANT, owned b mercenary HALE CAESAR. Along the length of the building i colorful SIGN that reads “HALE CAESAR’S KILLER TACOS,” beneath this is an inscription in script: “That Which Doe Not Kill Us Makes Us Stronger.” Over a wide shot of the colorful establishment, we hear:

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ++.-So I’ve checked out as much as I can from the outside, but we got to get up close to see if this is a ‘do-able’ op.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HALE CAESAR’S - DAY BARNEY, KONG, CHRISTMAS and HALE CAESAR sit together drin at the rear of the restaurant. LATIN TECHNO MUSIC plays i the background. The SIX PARROTS are on their elaborate PERCHES. A PARROT screeches.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why do these birds gotta be so loud?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: People like ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Then put ‘em on the menu.  29. KONG disapprovingly studies a TACO resting in his plate. his FOREARM and likewise HALE CAESAR is the ‘EXPENDABLES’ TATTOO of the RAVEN sitting on a SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Why this place, ‘Corza?’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Maybe it won't be Corza, but we need to put some boots on the ground and check it out, and see if it’s worth the risk.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Nothin’ is worth the risk. Always travelin’ - Always bad places - (eyes the taco) Always bad food. Gets boring. (to Hale Caesar) I don’t like your food.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Why? ‘Cause it ain’t movin’?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’s your problem, Kong?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: My son is going bad. KONG takes the ‘despised’ TACO and puts it on the floor beside him. HALE CAESAR bristles.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Kong) What’s ‘bad’ mean?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (ignores Hale Caesar) ‘Bad’ means bad - He’s not growing up ‘normal.’ We’re stupid because we spend more time helpin’ ‘strangers’ than helpin’ our families.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: I hear that -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - You don’t have family - You have birds.  30.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: You have zero, Cabrone. The DOOR opens and RICHARD enters. He’s tall, very well built, and mysterious, a Latin James Dean reincarnate.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: That him?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Think so.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) That’s replacin’ Gunnar?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (points to Barney) His call. RICHARD'S extraordinary looks have definitely gotten the MEN’S competitive attention.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Pretty boys can’t fight.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re ugly and can’t fight either, so what's your point? RICHARD arrives at the TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, sorry I’m late - No parkin’ around here.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sit down - Everybody, this is Richard De La Fuego - Over there’s Lee Christmas, (pointing) Kong Kao, and Hale Caesar, who owns this death trap - Let’s finish up.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Yo, where you from?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter -

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: I’m askin’ a simple question - Don’t he have a voice?  31. RICHARD is taking it all in stride.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Maybe Big Dick’s feelin’ shy around this group?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (extremely calm) No - But you can call me Richard.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ‘Richard?’

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: .+-If you don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You got a problem with the name ‘Big Dick’?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (smiles to himself) No, I have no problem with Big Dick at all, but I like Richard.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Who'd you work for?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: That’s not your business.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (indignant) Not my business? (standing) You got something to hide?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Stand on a chair. He’1l think you're a giant.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) Hey! (to Richard) We don’t have secrets here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (nonplussed) ...Everybody has secrets -  32.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Not here - But tell us what we want to know or we’ll be takin’ turns kickin’ your ass.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You can try. HALE CAESAR eyes CHRISTMAS challengingly. Suddenly a PARR high decibel SCREECH pierces the room.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Jesus! It’s like a needle in your brain!

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: ...-They yell like that when they’re not nesting - I raised birds growing up. This stops everyone dead, especially CAESAR. CHRISTMAS shakes his head in dismay. HALE CAESAR begins t laugh.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: If the official ‘ball-breaking’s done, lets get back to business.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: How many soldiers does this island have?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s a small place - wouldn’t take more than a few hundred good ones to control the island. KONG and HALE CAESAR look skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We'll check it out - Maybe it’s not as crazy as it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Don’t sound crazy to you ‘cause you are crazy.  33.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Right now we don’t know that much, except they’ve got a half-assed dictator who’s takin’ the place down and had his men kill a young American who was helpin’ out the locals.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) He’s not listening.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: I have my own problems.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Kong) Let’s hear it.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: My son is growin’ up all wrong. The hair, the talk, the clothes, what he likes is not normal.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: And you're ‘normal?’

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Yes - I’m normal.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: We are successful at what we do, failures at everything else - we are the ‘half people.’

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Seriously, stick to kicking people.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Kong, we’ve been hearin’ this for years. Let your kid be who he’s gonna be and stop tryin’ to make him you, you’re a one-off. And what’s normal? Look at Hale Caesar. A black man named after a bad weather report, who thinks he’s Mexican, normal? Not really. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY (cont'd) Christmas? Normal? He falls in love more than Pepe Le Pew.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: And me, a walking billboard on how not to live your life, if you want to have a life - I had to wear a name tag around my kids - So what's normal? That said, this team doesn’t work without you an’ that’s too bad cause lately you’ve become a huge pain in the ass, but we love you.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (smiles) ...-Don’t say that. BARNEY smiles and pats KONG on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (gestures to Christmas) Let’s travel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CORZAN WOMEN work in the fields. -- A STARVED DOG roams the muddy streets, looking for scr -- General Garza’s khaki-clad, hostile SOLDIERS patrol th town square. -- Children play in the gutters. -- Peeling POSTERS of GENERAL GARZA are on every structur In the background are CORZA’S formative mountains that ar lush with dense foliage. A large GRUMMAN UF-26 ALBATROSS SEAPLANE swoops into view OCEAN SPRAY arcs beside the plane’s large PONTOONS as it powers down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A near dilapidated CUSTOM’S OFFICE comes into view as BARNEY'S SEAPLANE rumbles into view. He cuts the engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY adjusts the controls, as CHRISTMAS eyes the bleak surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: .--Nice place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS stand in front of a sunken-eyed CUST AGENT. On the wall is a LARGE PHOTO of GENERAL GARZA. Nea TWO RAWBONED SOLDIERS lounge in a pair of worn CHAIRS. A CEILING FAN overhead is barely spinning at two revolution per minute. An UNSHAVEN CUSTOMS AGENT eyes the men’s PASSPORTS.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: (heavy accent) Why you here? BARNEY hands over a BUSINESS CARD.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Looking at land development properties.

dialogues.speaker: AGENT
dialogues.text: How long are you here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Maybe a day. The AGENT hands them back their PASSPORTS. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS move off as the CUSTOMS AGENT eyes t SOLDIERS, then reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS wander the streets of the main city. pair of LOCAL SPIES, men in their late 20’s, attempt to inconspicuously trail the TWO MERCENARIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS and BARNEY move closer to what could be conside the CENTER of the depressed city. The pair of LOCAL SPIES continue to trail BARNEY and CHRISTMAS. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS pause in front of a WEATHERED STOREFRONT, and in the shop’s window see the reflection o the SPIES observing them from the opposite side of the street.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Gotta take ‘em out. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS move off in opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: SPIES
dialogues.text: Seeing this, they split off and follow BARNEY and CHRISTM SEPARATELY.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Halfway down the nearly deserted street, they both CROSS the other side of the street. They now have managed to FL the trailing SPIES, and proceed to approach one another, having the SPIES caught in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: SPIES
dialogues.text: They attempt to maintain nonchalant attitude as BARNEY an CHRISTMAS approach them from opposite directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BARNEY passes by, a MINI SYRINGE in his hand jabs into first SPY’S leg. The spy barely feels the puncture as BAR casually moves on.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: now passes his target, and also secretly jams his syringe point into SPY #2’s side.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: slows his pace as CHRISTMAS pulls along side and they mov off. BARNEY checks his WATCH.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...Twenty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Thirty.

dialogues.speaker: SPIES
dialogues.text: The drug is rapidly taking effect as one SPY slumps semi- consciously against a crumbling STUCCO WALL. Sliding to t ground, he draws very little attention.

dialogues.speaker: SPY
dialogues.text: enters a SMALL STOREFRONT and once inside collapses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loud HONKING. TWO MILITARY JEEPS followed by an open back MILITARY TRUCK crammed with 20 HARD-CORE SOLDIERS rumble along the narrow main street. CORZAN FLAGS fly from the corners of the hoods of all the vehicles. Though slightly obscured, we see BARNEY and CHRISTMAS pass into view.  38. Across the street is a STATUE of GENERAL GARZA on a TEN F PEDESTAL. The intimidated LOCALS jump aside as the CONVOY approache intersection. An OLD MAN struggling to push a RICKETY CAR full of junk out of the way, passes in front of the MAIN HORNS blare. The OLD MAN stands petrified. This disrespec definitely not tolerated. TWO LARGE AMERICAN OPERATIVES, dressed in khaki, leap fro the LEAD JEEP and berate the OLD MAN. Stepping out of the SECOND JEEP is PAINE. The big man is wearing a conspicuous SHOULDER HOLSTER. In his thick hand an equally thick, short BLACK CLUB attached to a LEATHER STRAP. PAINE motions to the SOLDIERS who pour out of the TRUCK a commence to shoving people aside, then SMASHING the OLD M cart. The TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES push the OLD MAN and send him sprawling to the sidewalk as the SOLDIERS RE-BOARD the TRANSPORT TRUCK. The LOCALS share in the man’s pain, but terrified to show any outward emotion. PAINE climbs back his JEEP and the motorcade is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: They sound American. An OLDER WOMAN suddenly starts to yell curses at the departing motorcade CAR. A group of patrolling SOLDIERS r forward and commence to roughing her up. ANOTHER WOMAN, (SANDRA,) naturally attractive, (20’s,) implores the guar to release the poor woman. One soldier is about to drive a RIFLE BUTT against her he when the SERGEANT OF THE GUARD grabs her and flings her against the wall, curses her nose to nose, then moves off All the intimidated BYSTANDERS quickly move off. Without hesitation, CHRISTMAS approaches SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You alright? She looks confused by the Americans’ presence. BARNEY eye the departing SOLDIERS, then joins CHRISTMAS and SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I said, are you alright? You need help?  39.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (Latin accent) I am good - Thank you - You are Americans?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: So why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: She doesn’t waste words.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We're looking at real estate - We're developers. SANDRA suspiciously eyes them.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Developers?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: There’s not much to see.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You never know - Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You know, we could use someone to show us around. Someone who knows the place like she does. (to Sandra) What do you think? Have some time to give us a tour?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: You can pay for gas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY Dust kicks up from the partially paved road as SANDRA dri her terribly rundown mini PICKUP TRUCK towards the outski of town.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SANDRA’S PICK UP TRUCK - DAY SANDRA drives while BARNEY sits in the middle and CHRISTM rides shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Not many Americans come here - Not now - They used to - Now there’s nothing right in Corza.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (charmingly) I wouldn’t say that. BARNEY leans over to CHRISTMAS and speaks so only his fri can hear.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We're here to work.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I know that.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: She’s not your type.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Stay focused.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) No problem. BARNEY shows SANDRA the photo that was given to him by MR CHURCH. His thumb covers the image of BILL, the murdered YOUNG AMERICAN’S body.  41.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We want to see this place first.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Why here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We want to see the view.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: There is no view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s see it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSKIRTS OF TOWN
dialogues.text: BARNEY, CHRISTMAS and SANDRA ride in SANDRA’S MINI-PICKUP TRUCK. They rock uncomfortably down a pot-holed road. The extreme poverty affects BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: How long do you stay here?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Depends -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - One day -

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (shakes her head at the irony) You do like all the rest - Just come an’ go ‘cause nothing is here worth staying for.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (double entendre) Maybe there could be.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes, ‘maybe’ if Fuentes was still here.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Who's Fuentes?  42.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Miguel Fuentes - the former president. SANDRA and CHRISTMAS are impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where’s Fuentes now?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Some soldiers have said he’s dead. Some say he’s in prison - No one knows. He was the last chance this place had.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: He tried to make things better - When he was president, he had people come to invest - People from Europe came here to see if there was anything of value in Corza to help the people live better.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What were they looking for?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Gas - Oil - Like what was found near Cuba last year - They were still looking when Garza took over and many people were killed - Now we are what you see, a dying place. A group of SOLDIERS have pinned several YOUNG MEN against wall. They are being interrogated.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: They act like this all the time?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Most are scared - Garza’s killed many soldiers he thought were loyal to Fuentes - Now they try to show how loyal they are to him. BARNEY looks out the window as their VEHICLE passes filth bare footed CHILDREN carrying BUCKETS of brackish water a joyless adults clad in near thread bare RAGS slump agains crumbling HOUSE/SHACKS.  43.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Nobody should have to live like this -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (sympathetically) No, they shouldn’t...Anyway, ever been to the states, Sandra?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You’d like it -

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Yes, but this is my country - It’s bad now, but I still love it.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I understand - But if you can have a shot at a better life, why not take it?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Focus -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Relax - (to Sandra) “Tienes che encontrar un hombre qhe siempre se quedara despierto solo para verte dormir.” SANDRA eyes him and turns away embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Christmas) What’d you say?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: He said - “Someday I will find a man who will be happy to stay awake just to watch me sleep.”

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It’s a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Maybe - But when men talk like that to a woman they do not know, they sound - (searching) ‘tonto.’

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Don’t know that word.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (not mean spirited) Ah - Tonto - Foolish? - Like a fool.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (tightly) Of all the words -

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) I don’t think any serious person talks like this and means it, do you? You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (dry) Pull over.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You heard - Just pull over! SANDRA pulls to the side of the dirt road and CHRISTMAS g out of the TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (walking) ‘A fool?’ Is it me that’s messed up or the world?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon, get in.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Rather chew my arm off, seriously - See you back at the plane.  45. BARNEY realizes he’s not changing his friend’s mind and r enters the truck.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I’m sorry - I did not mean anything bad.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s alright - Are we close?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: -..Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and SANDRA stand beside a BERM along the barely discernible dirt road.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: This the place you wanted to see?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah. BARNEY holds up one of the PHOTOGRAPHS of CHURCH’S slain GRANDSON. The PALACE’S TOWER looms in the picture’s background.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Who are you both really? BARNEY walks off the road and holds the picture up again. steps over a low DIRT BERM.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (taking pictures) Did you know about the American that was killed here? SANDRA is extremely uncomfortable and remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (awkwardly) No.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: He spent a lot of time in Corza -  46.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: I don’t know about him. Suddenly they’re alerted by the GROANING ENGINE of a larg MILITARY TRUCK that quickly pulls into view. EIGHT ANGRY SOLDIERS pile out.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Oh God - Please, don’t say anything wrong - Let me talk.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) What’re you doing here? Stay where you are! The EIGHT SOLDIERS surround BARNEY and SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I said - What’re you doing here!?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: He wants to know what you’re doing.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Just taking pictures.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) He’s just a tourist. The SARGENT LEADER steps uncomfortably close to BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You’re lying! Give me the camera!! Now!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: He wants the camera - The LEADER smacks SANDRA to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Shut up, Puta - You’re next! As BARNEY faces SANDRA, the LEADER blind-side punches him BARNEY STAGGERS, but remains upright. The CAMERA falls to ground.  47.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) They move, shoot them!! Not knowing how to open a digital camera, the LEADER SMAS it against a rock.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Please - He’s leaving today. We didn’t do anything!

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Lying bitch! The LEADER again goes to strike Sandra, but BARNEY blocks blow, then is blind-sided with a rifle butt to his side, which drops him painfully to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Get them!! Take them both!! Now!! Being restrained by one of the SOLDIERS, SANDRA struggles her life. She manages to break free.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Get her! Suddenly BARNEY rockets his fist into the LEADER’S groin. LEADER buckles in half and BARNEY breaks his windpipe wit vicious chopping blow. Ripping free the LEADER'S SIDEARM, puts a bullet through the NECK of SOLDIER #2. Rolling to one knee, he blows a hole through SOLDIER #3 a #4's chests. BARNEY then wheels around and fires upward, hitting SOLDI #5 directly under the chin.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Run! ! Nearly frozen in terror, SANDRA now runs for her life. SOLDIER #6 races after her. BARNEY is out of AMMO and SOLDIER #7 takes aim. Suddenly, a slicing sound cuts through the air and a THRO KNIFE buries itself into SOLDIER #7’s chest.  48. As SOLDIER #8 turns in the direction the knife came from, SECOND THROWING KNIFE buries itself into the man’s HEART. The throaty engine of the TRANSPORT TRUCK roars to life a CHRISTMAS races into view. Without breaking stride CHRISTMAS tears the THROWING KNIF out of DEAD SOLDIER #8’'S body, then races through the fo attempting to intercept the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MILITARY TRUCK
dialogues.text: is building speed as it descends the DANGEROUS WINDING RO that borders a STEEP, nauseating drop off. SOLDIER #6 stands on the truck’s FLATBED with SANDRA’S HA seized in one hand while his AUTOMATIC WEAPON is held rea in the other. The truck’s frantic DRIVER yells into a WALKIE-TALKIE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CITY -— DUSK A bearded LIEUTENANT monitors the truck driver’s panicked transmission on his WALKIE-TALKIE. Around him are SIX SOLDIERS. The LIEUTENANT angrily bellows to the SOLDIERS and they instantly pile into an oversized JEEP-TRANSPORT CARRIER.

dialogues.speaker: JUNGLE GROWTH
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS tears through the DENSE FOLIAGE like an enraged animal, until he arrives at an ELEVATED OVERHANG. The fle truck is just about to pass ten feet below. CHRISTMAS leaps high into the air and drops feet first on the startled SOLDIER, instantly breaking his neck. The startled DRIVER attempts to remove his PISTOL as CHRISTMAS heaves his THROWING KNIFE. But the truck’s TURBULENT motion causes the KNIFE to miss it’s intended target and imbeds itself up to the hilt in the truck’s th WINDSHIELD.  49. CHRISTMAS lunges forward and latching onto one of the tru bare METAL ROOF’S STANCHIONS, knees the DRIVER squarely i the temple, knocking him unconscious and out of the truck The DRIVERLESS truck swerves toward a sheer 300 FOOT drop off. CHRISTMAS rushes to SANDRA and seizing her arm, pull her off the doomed truck. The TRUCK begins it’s long descent into the STEEP CHASM, until it’s finally shattered against the jagged rocks bel CHRISTMAS and SANDRA have barely managed to land on the road’s outermost edge.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: wheels SANDRA’S TRUCK into view and skids to a precarious stop as CHRISTMAS and SANDRA leap in and they roar off. INT. SANDRA’S TRUCK - DAY The small TRUCK is barely able to negotiate the dangerous curves as BARNEY, CHRISTMAS and SANDRA speed down the treacherous road.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) She stays here she’s dead!! (to Sandra) You’re comin’ with us.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We have a plane.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No - But I can’t leave! I have no passport! Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Do you have family here?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: No -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Then you’re going.  50.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA'S PALACE
dialogues.text: The MAMMOTH GATES swing open and a JEEP roars out, occupi by the American Operative PAINE and his TWO OTHER HENCHME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUCK speeds towards the SEAPLANE MOORING. As they approach, the island’s CUSTOMS SHACK comes into v BARNEY skids the TRUCK nearly into a TREE and cuts the engine.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Fire it up! I’1l take care of them.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Gimme a thirty second lead! CHRISTMAS and SANDRA sprint away as BARNEY anxiously chec the sweeping SECONDS HAND of his watch.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: In the JEEP the BEARDED LIEUTENANT and his MEN barrel wil down the narrow street nearly slamming into the many poor VENDORS and PEDESTRIANS, who leap from the thundering vehicle’s path. The incensed LIEUTENANT is yelling into a hand held RADIO as the jeep’s HORN blares at an oncoming TRUCK that veers violently onto the sidewalk, and crashes into a STOREFRONT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAINE and the TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES race their JEEP at breakneck speed through the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS jumps onto the PONTOON and whips open the huge planes’ SIDE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C’mon, get in!! SANDRA balks. CHRISTMAS heaves the MOORING LINES free.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Jump! Get in!! SANDRA takes a step forward grabbing CHRISTMAS’ hand, the she suddenly pulls it free.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing!?

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: You go! She starts to backpedal.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C’mon, jump on! We’1ll get you out!!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: You go! You don’t belong here! SANDRA turns and runs off. Having no choice, CHRISTMAS le inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BEARDED LIEUTENANT and his SQUAD continue to dangerou wheel their vehicle wildly through the narrow streets. Th PORT now comes into view. The LIEUTENANT snatches up the HAND MIC of the Jeep’s CB RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO SOLDIERS, who had been playing cards, are momenta startled as the Seaplane’s ENGINES roar to life. They don hear BARNEY entering through the REAR DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the huge ENGINES and thundering PROPS resoun throughout the port area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The startled SOLDIERS leap to their feet. In that split second, BARNEY smashes the first SOLDIER wi CHAIR as the SECOND SOLDIER is knocked unconscious by a . PISTOL that BARNEY pulls from the small of his back. The CUSTOMS OFFICIAL attempts to flee, but BARNEY fires a SHO into the back of his leg, dropping the man instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wiping the sweat from his eyes, CHRISTMAS anxiously looks BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: C’mon, you insane Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DOCK —- DUSK As the rumbling SEAPLANE powers along the SHORT DOCK, it’ whirling PROPS kick up a MASSIVE wall of SPRAY.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: bursts out of the SHACK, dashes to the PIER and leaps thr the blinding spray landing on the plane’s MASSIVE PONTOON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing this, CHRISTMAS jams the throttles and the metal b explodes with unbridled horsepower that violently shakes plane’s entire structure. Struggling against the hurrican force of the PROP WASH, BARNEY manages to pull himself inside.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: who is partially hidden behind the corner of a nearby structure, observes this then rushes toward her TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Completely drenched, BARNEY swings into the copilot’s sea

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Where’s the girl?!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: She wouldn’t leave! Leaning out of the side COCKPIT WINDOW, BARNEY sees the J TRANSPORT roar into view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: It’s gonna be close!

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: reaches her truck just as the SOLDIER’S JEEP rolls past.

dialogues.speaker: JEEP
dialogues.text: Skidding to a stop the SOLDIERS pile out and fire wildly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY and CHRISTMAS are at the controls.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to plane) Climb, Girl, climb! CHRISTMAS manages a rapidly shrinking glimpse of SANDRA speeding away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: DOCK — DUSK PAINE and the TWO OTHER AMERICAN OPERATIVES speed towards soldiers and slide to a shuttering stop.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: leaps out then viciously rips a SOLDIER’S RIFLE out of th startled man’s hands, and begins FIRING at the rising PLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just when it appears they’re out of harm’s way, PAINE’S bullets rip through the rear of the plane’s fuselage.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Bankin’! MORE BULLETS tear into the plane as BARNEY SNAPS the STEE WHEEL hard. The old SEA PLANE tilts drastically on it’s s

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Out of AMMO and enraged, he snatches another SOLDIER'S RI and FIRES until the CLIP is empty.  55.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banking at an almost impossible angle, the soaring SEAPLA curves around the island’s protective cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE is still severely BANKING as CHRISTMAS stares o the SIDE WINDOW to see the last portion of the PORT disappear.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why’re we still ‘banking?’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Didn’t say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Yellow shower?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MASSIVE SEAPLANE suddenly bursts into view over the towering cliffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of THUNDERING ENGINES startled the SOLDIERS and PAINE, who were in the process of departing. The SEAPLANE now proceeds to DIVE BOMB directly toward th dumbfounded SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the COCKPIT WINDSHIELD the SOLDIERS are seen froz in confusion. CHRISTMAS unbuckles and struggles against t MOUNTING G-FORCE.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Got it. CHRISTMAS reaches for a FLARE PISTOL that’s attached to t BULKHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Having reached it’s maximum speed, the SHUTTERING plane swoops down along the length of the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PETRIFIED SOLDIERS now run for their lives. PAINE defiantly stands his ground.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (to the fleeing soldiers) Stay! They have no weapons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLARE PISTOL in hand, CHRISTMAS pulls open the SIDE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Go! BARNEY pulls a HANDLE situated on the floor beside his se

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GAS begins to drain from the large auxiliary FUEL PODS fastened beneath each WING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleeing SOLDIERS freeze when they see a thick whirlin YELLOW CLOUD of mist about to descend on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS leans out and fires the FLARE GUN at the drench dock. Several BULLETS fired by PAINE tear holes in the pl just above CHRISTMAS’ head.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DOCK —- DUSK The RED HOT FLARE collides against the OLD WOODEN STRUCTU and a mammoth curling FIREBALL erupts with colossal force

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: leap into the water as the wave of destruction envelops everything in it’s path. The curling FLAMES sweep over th JEEPS, blowing them sky high. The burning wreckage crashe into the water, nearly crushing SEVERAL SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE is barely avoiding a catastrophe as the swirlin GAS WAVE threatens to reach up to the plane itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning from the plane’s SIDE DOOR, CHRISTMAS nervously observes the FLAMES nearly curling up to the WINGS and GA PODS.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Bail!! BARNEY sharply cuts the WHEEL then twists the GAS VALVE s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TIDAL GAS WAVE ceases inches from the PLANE, which no ARCS gracefully out to sea.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. DESTROYED DOCK —- DUSK With the dock engulfed in FLAMES, PAINE, along with traumatized SOLDIERS, swim wearily to shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS returns to the COCKPIT. BARNEY stares stoically straight ahead. CHRISTMAS suddenly pounds the side of the FUSELAGE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Why would anybody stay in this hell hole?!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Guts.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Think they'll find her?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Probably.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We're coming back.  59.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No we're not.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We met this girl, used her, now we're responsible. Seriously, I’m coming back one way or another. BARNEY studies CHRISTMAS’ resolute expression. Reflective he glances out the side window.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Y'know, maybe we could take this place down.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: -.-Let me think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRONING ENGINES now slowly fade into a TRANQUIL HUM a the AIRCRAFT glides gracefully into the SUNSET.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. GARZA’S PALACE - NIGHT A WIDE SHOT depicts great activity in the COURTYARD as SOLDIERS are being loaded onto TRANSPORT TRUCKS while ano TRUCK loaded with SOLDIERS, rumbles out of the MASSIVE GA

dialogues.speaker: PALACE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: The BEARDED LIEUTENANT and the other SIX SOLDIERS that we useless in stopping BARNEY and CHRISTMAS escape, are boun and gagged as they stand trembling before GENERAL GARZA. In front of the MEN is a SQUAD of SOLDIERS with their RIF trained on the BEARDED LIEUTENANT’S SQUAD. Beside GARZA i PAINE.  60.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You let them kill and get away? Two of them? (grabs the bearded lieutenant by the beard) (to soldiers) You are a bad leader - Maybe it is the beard. GARZA nods to SEVERAL SOLDIERS and the BEARDED LIEUTENANT SQUAD is dragged off.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: No more beards -— (to Paine) You work for me, find the girl! He shoves PAINE who bristles. He’d like to smash this man into a tiny wet spot. PAINE moves off.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (puts pistol to Paine’s head) I am so mad I can’t feel my hands - (cocks pistol) Yes, you work for me. PAINE glares at him then moves off.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CORZA (SANDRA’S HOME) - NIGHT This modest crumbling STRUCTURE is on the OUTSKIRTS of th city. SANDRA’S partly observed TRUCK is parked out of vie The SIDE DOOR swings open and SANDRA appears with a CLOTH SACK crammed with provisions. Rapidly entering her TRUCK, is gone into the night.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HALE CAESAR’S - EARLY MORNING The SUN is barely up. We hear MR. CHURCH’S VOICE over the WIDE SHOT.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How did it go in Corza?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CAESAR’S — DAWN The establishment is dark except for the early RAYS OF SUNLIGHT that angle through the LARGE SKYLIGHTS. BARNEY sits at a ROUND TABLE with CHRISTMAS, KONG, HALE CAESAR and RICHARD. Most of the men still look half aslee

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No problem. smirks.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: But we think Garza could be under the agency’s protection. We saw some personnel there that fit the bill.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: The imposing man is seated behind a LARGE DESK in a CLASSICALLY DECORATED OFFICE.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Why would the CIA be involved with Garza?

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: HALE CAESAR’S

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Your grandson ever mention anything about American personnel on the island?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: No - Does all this mean you’re passing?  62. BARNEY remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CHURCH’S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (overriding) - The fee’s five million. CHURCH is momentarily taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Plus expenses - Half to be deposited in two separate off shore accounts today - In or out?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: What if it is the agency that’s over there?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Our problem - In or out?

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: In.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You'll be sent the account numbers. BARNEY hangs up and faces the GROUP.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Alright, we need weapons. (gestures at Christmas, Richard and Kong) Our usual armor got busted, but made arrangements to get what we need from the new supplier. Christmas knows the locale of the supplier in Tijuana.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Hate that place.  63.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it, you’re not going.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: How do you know we can trust this new ‘replacement?’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We don’t - But he says he’s got what we need and it’s untraceable.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Kong) If it smells bad, we’re outta there.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You guys get moving - Richard, your first assignment, enjoy. RICHARD smiles and rises.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Covering our asses. BARNEY rises and holds up a CD ROM and motions to HALE CAESAR.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I wanna show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAINE leans over a bank of monitors. A seated TECHNICIAN with the controls. On the SCREEN is a bad SECURITY CAMERA recording from the CUSTOMS SHACK.  64. Standing directly behind PAINE is FEMALE SENIOR CHIEF INTELLIGENCE OFFICER, B.W. MONROE, (50’s.) She’s not seen clearly yet, but we sense an ominous presence.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Go in closer. The technician does. BARNEY’S face is seen but too hazy f clear identification. CHRISTMAS’ face is blocked behind BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Their equipment’s ancient.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...I see that. New FOOTAGE appears. It’s a SKIP-FRAME recording of BARNE knocking the CUSTOMS SOLDIER UNCONSCIOUS and FIRING a sho the CUSTOMS AGENT, who's OFF screen. Monroe now steps int view

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to technician) We need this person identified as soon as possible, that means yesterday - Enhance the hell out of it - Step out, please. The TECHNICIAN exits.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Was the girl that was with them ID’d? - Who was she? You have a name yet?

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Sandra Campas, a local, she'll be in custody soon if Garza doesn’t kill her first.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Just go back and pacify that paranoid bastard. Tell him he has our commitment. Nothing like this will happen again and I need to know what this Sandra Campas knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. SANDRA’S HOUSE - NIGHT A HALF DOZEN SOLDIERS holding powerful HALOGEN FLASHLIGHT tear through the house.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. SANDRA’S HOUSE - NIGHT As the SOLDIERS pour out of the dwelling, we see that SANDRA’S NEIGHBORS have been pulled from their homes and being brutally interrogated.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA'S PALACE
