dialogues.text: We see a WIDE SHOT of the oppressive walled structure. Th SOUND of HEAVY FOOTSTEPS reverberating on stone is heard the PALACE’S image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE SOLDIERS lead GENERAL GARZA down an incredibly blea and mildewed mortar CORRIDOR.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT CELLS
dialogues.text: Arriving at a ROW of heavily rusted STEEL DOORS, the CELL GUARD immediately jams a KEY into the LOCK of the CENTER CELL. The DOOR groans open revealing FORMER PRESIDENT MIGUEL FUENTES, a slender, unhealthy man of FIFTY FIVE. TWO SOLD rush in and yank him upright. GENERAL GARZA enters and calmly approaches FUENTES. With baleful expression, he GLARES into the hopeless man’s eye

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You brought them?  66.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: Who? GARZA’S patience has reached it’s limit. Bellowing in rag he raises his fist.

dialogues.speaker: CELL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: GARZA’'S guttural yell reverberates down the hallway foll by the THUD of FUENTES’ BODY hitting the cell floor. INT. HALE CAESAR’S BACK OFFICE BARNEY and HALE CAESAR sit riveted to images of CORZA tha are being displayed on a LARGE COMPUTER SCREEN. These are PHOTOS that BARNEY has taken. He stops at an image at the locale of the murder of the YOUNG AMERICAN.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: See it?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: No - What am I suppose to be seeing? BARNEY magnifies the image.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Bottom left -

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: The cigarette butt?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, the name on the filter says Oberst - See it? HALE CAESAR studies the PHOTO, baffled.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Oberst is a first class European cigarette. There’s no way Garza’s men would be smokin’ that brand. I need to get a list of any European visitors to Corza say in the last three months. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY (cont'd) The best place to start would be private plane manifests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL and LICKSON stride down the fairly active and endles hallway. WILL eyes a slightly enhanced STILL SHOT of BARN taken from the SURVEILLANCE CAMERA in CORZA.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Where'd you get this?

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: From a friend in surveillance. A C.0.0. intel officer named Monroe, who’s working up front for the Special Activities Division wants it ID'd.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: They must’ve ‘made’ Ross, planning a new op is the only explanation.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Thing is, if they don’t know who he is, how'd they know to put “eyes” on him?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Because they weren’t watching him, and were watching over another company target and he walked into it by accident - This is good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY enters with a cardboard DOCUMENT BOX.

dialogues.speaker: PUBLIC STORAGE CLERK
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I need a unit, please. BARNEY slides a CREDIT CARD across the counter. The clerk reads the name, MICHAEL AVERMAN.  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF OPERATIONS OFFICER MONROE enters the lift. As the d close, a HAND juts in and WILL enters. The doors

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Sorry - You’re Chief Operations Officer Monroe?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I’m Agent Will Sands, currently assigned to off-shore Operations. close and the elevator LURCHES into motion.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Can I have a few minutes of your time?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (pleasantly) Of course, but not much more.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Our division was issued a mandate from the Deputy Director’s office to start shutting down private contractors working abroad. This man’s been ‘off and on’ our radar for several years, so we need to know where this was taken. WILL hands her the hazy photo of BARNEY. She fights off h annoyance. The doors

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Word has it this photo started circulating from your office. open and they step into... THE INNER SANCTUM OF CIA HEADQUARTERS. Monroe strides thr rows of cubicles.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we could’ve been surveilling another target when he wandered into the picture by accident?  69.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Have you crossed paths with this man before?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yes - A few years back.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (pulls up short) Really? Then you must know his name...You must have it on file, right? MONROE’S cool demeanor makes WILL hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No - We just have aliases. Look, I know about inner agency rivalry, but I can help here, I know how he operates and you know the locale he might be targeting next -- Monroe reaches a CLOSED OFFICE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Look, here's the problem, Will, we really don’t care about how he operates, we only care about keeping him away from classified company operations that are underway, but if you come across information, any information that’ll assist in identifying him, that would be appreciated. I wish I could tell you more, but like everyone else, I have orders to follow. Nice meeting you, Agent. MONROE offers a polite nod and moves off leaving a frustr WILL in her wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a WOODED AREA down a slight BERM, a PAIR of SOLDIERS c across SANDRA’S TRUCK, which has been covered in BRANCHES PALMS.  70. The TEN WHEEL TROOP TRUCK pulls SANDRA’S TRUCK into clear view as the SQUAD LEADER speaks into the ARMY TRUCK’S CB MICROPHONE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. GARZA’S CHAMBERS - DAY A WALKIE-TALKIE rests in GARZA’S hand. Standing on the BALCONY, GARZA stares blankly into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD LEADER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) ...We have found the woman’s truck - We will look north now, over. GARZA’S jaw muscles tighten.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. - AGENT LICKSON’S OFFICE Another MALE AGENT stands in front of LICKSON’S DESK. She reads a MEMO in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Good work - But I want all info sent to his office first.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WILL’S OFFICE - DAY WILL’s at his desk in a very unspectacular windowless off as an extensive list of RANDOM NAMES scrolls up his computer’s screen. It finally locks on to the name: MICHA AVERMAN. WILL is charged. LICKSON enters.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: You called?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Yeah, one of the known aliases that Ross has used in the past has come up - He must be getting careless because he used to rent space in a storage facility in San Diego. It’s definitely worth checking out.  71.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Then check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain VAN carrying RICHARD, KONG and CHRISTMAS pass the local CUSTOM AGENTS and cross into MEXICO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing through Tijuana’s main business district, the VAN finally turns onto a poorly lit side street. CHRISTMAS spots a fairly bland looking TWO STORY BUILDING SIGN hanging out front reads in Spanish “THE HORSE CLUB.”

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: I have bad feelings.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Relax. Experience Mexico. RICHARD pulls the VAN to the curb, which is lined with a amount of VEHICLES.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Park it, then come inside. KONG and CHRISTMAS jump out. RICHARD appears unhappy at b treated like an errand boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The faint sound of THUNDER is heard as a LIGHT RAIN begin fall. KONG and CHRISTMAS approach. Thudding music filters onto deserted street. TWO PROFESSIONAL THUGS loiter out front. KONG and CHRISTMAS exchange perplexed expressions then en

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music leaps in decibels as KONG and CHRISTMAS enter t establishment.  72. Immediately they are taken aback. They are surrounded by all shapes and sizes. The boisterous PATRONS are dancing, drinking and mingling in a celebratory fashion. Welcome t one of the city’s most infamous GAY CLUBS.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Wrong place?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Right place. The PATRONS begin to notice the new ‘out of place’ arriva KONG is growing anxious.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: There’s no guns here.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It’s the right place.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: I’m leavin.’

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Hey, nobody wants you - C’mon. They start to angle through the PATRONS who are now very aware of the strangers.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: The contact’s name’s Emanuel. A LARGE, INTOXICATED, TANK-TOPPED HISPANIC MAN moves into their path. He SPEAKS RAPIDLY in SPANISH at KONG who look totally confused.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What’d he say?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Poor bastard must be blind.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What’d he say?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: He wants to dance - With you. CHRISTMAS speaks to the man in Spanish and the MAN smiles moves off.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What’d you say?  73.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: You'd love to, maybe later.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: enters the CLUB. Instantly his mood darkens. He spots KON and CHRISTMAS. His ‘looks’ have attracted a great deal of attention.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: This can’t be the place?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: It is - A COUPLE of MEN cruise past RICHARD. RICHARD tenses as hi mind races. CHRISTMAS gestures to a BOUNCER standing at t BAR.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We need Emanuel... (to Richard) Richard, go ask goon #1. RICHARD sighs and heads off to the thick-necked BOUNCER (

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: A sullen-faced 45 YEAR OLD sits in a guarded PRIVATE BOOT the back of the CLUB. Beside him is a young HUSTLER sport STREAKED HAIR. RICHARD, CHRISTMAS and KONG warily approach behind GOON # RICHARD speaks rapidly to a BODYGUARD who turns to ANOTHE GUARD who leans towards Emanuel and conveys RICHARD’S message. During this, RICHARD eyes the BODYGUARDS’ concea PISTOLS. EMANUEL nods while staying riveted on RICHARD, who shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) ...I’m expecting you - Richard, yes?  74.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (shocked) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Kong and Christmas ) Who are they?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I’m with them.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) You mean they’re with you? EMANUEL unexpectedly snaps at the MALE HUSTLER seated bes him.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: Get out - Gol The MALE HUSTLER tenses with indignation. Snapping like a rabid animal, EMANUEL seizes the HUSTLER’S hair in his powerful grip and roughly shoves him out of the BOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) I have your order - You have the money? RICHARD is about to translate.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: I understand - The money when we get what we came for. EMANUEL grimly smiles.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (broken English) Of course - Drive around back. RICHARD, KONG, and CHRISTMAS start to move off. EMANUEL firmly grips RICHARD’S arm in the booth.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (to Richard) You stay. RICHARD eyes CHRISTMAS and KONG.  75.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (hard) Keep me company.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We got it.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Take them out back - (to Richard) You sit here. Barely able to mask his loathing, RICHARD sits beside the repulsive MAN, as CHRISTMAS and KONG are guided away by a BODYGUARD. EMANUEL gestures to the array of BOOZE displayed on the TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Drink sometimes - Whatever you like - It’s all free.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m working.

dialogues.speaker: EMANUEL
dialogues.text: So am I - Drink? I don’t like to say things twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RAIN has picked up as the VAN moves down an ALLEYWAY located behind the CLUB. The faint sound of MUSIC emanati from within the club, drifts outdoors. Up ahead an ARMED GUARD slides open the WAREHOUSE DOOR and gestures for the to enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is jumping. In the PRIVATE BOOTH, EMANUEL is pl RICHARD with incessant seductive chatter. RICHARD feigns interest while his eyes register the positions of the HAL DOZEN BODYGUARDS that are placed throughout the club.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering, CHRISTMAS and KONG follow the glow of the VAN’S HEADLIGHTS as they travel into the recess of the dilapida building. RAIN leaks through the porous ROOF. Finally the VAN’S beams reveal a pair of PICKUP TRUCKS surrounded by SEVEN MEXICAN GANG MEMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: They’re going to try to kill us. Sensing the tension, CHRISTMAS tries to suppress his moun anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Seriously -—

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - I hate when you take that ‘crap’ out of your head and put it in mine. CHRISTMAS and KONG exit the van and extend their arms and patted down by TWO GANG MEMBERS. The GANG MEMBERS nod that they are ‘clean.’

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Show them. Two of the MEN hop into the truck bed and whip off a TARP revealing a PAIR OF CRATES. KONG climbs up to inspect the CADRE OF WEAPONRY.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: Have the money?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (points) In the van.  77. CHRISTMAS watches as one of the GANG MEMBERS approaches t van. Reaching into the front seat, he withdraws an ENVELO OF MONEY. CHRISTMAS locks eyes with KONG. Something’s off flash of MOVEMENT catches KONG’S eyes. The ‘MOVEMENT’ is from the outside GUARD, who has been sneaking forward. He fires at CHRISTMAS. The round tears his body shield, but he doesn’t go down. KONG SPINS behind one of the GANG MEMBERS and snaps his n He and CHRISTMAS SPRINT for cover. The GUARD fires away a the rest of the GANG MEMBERS pull PISTOLS from their truc CHRISTMAS and KONG disappear behind mounds of DEBRIS that piled nearby.

dialogues.speaker: LEADER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Get ‘em! A GANG MEMBER is startled by CHRISTMAS who explodes out o the shadows. He crushes the man’s NECK with the sharp edg his FOREARM. The wall behind CHRISTMAS erupts as bullets rip out concr in large CHUNKS. CHRISTMAS snatches up the dead GANG MEMB WEAPON, and diving to the ground, avoids gunfire then blo the GANG MEMBER away. As a GANG MEMBER passes a pillar, KONG smashes his foot i the man’s head with incredible force. KONG retrieves the man’s GUN and bolts away. Holding the money, the LEADER, along with a GANG MEMBER p into their TRUCK and fire it up.

dialogues.speaker: PICKUP TRUCK
dialogues.text: As the LEADER speeds toward the exit door, CHRISTMAS spri toward the fleeing truck on a sharp angle. The GANG MEMBER riding in the passenger seat fires at Christmas through the front WINDSHIELD. CHRISTMAS fires back and empties his clip into the GANG MEMBER.  78. Appearing out of nowhere, KONG leaps onto the back of the veering truck and snatches a GRENADE from the weapons sta on the truck’s FLATBED. Pulling the PIN, he tosses it thr the passenger side window and leaps. The truck’s cabin EXPLODES ripping the roof skyward, unti collides with the factory CEILING sending down a torrent CEMENT and DUST. The last remaining GANG MEMBER bolts out of the WAREHOUSE with CHRISTMAS in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The REAR DOOR bursts open as the terrified GANG MEMBER charges through. Immediately he’s slammed into the wall b HUGE BODYGUARD. The GANG MEMBER yells that a ‘CRAZY AMERI is going to kill him. He no sooner finishes the statement when CHRISTMAS appears. The BODYGUARD tosses the GANG MEM aside and reaches for the PISTOL in his WAISTBAND. Still charging forward, CHRISTMAS whips a THROWING KNIFE is concealed in a custom SHEATH at the base of his NECK. KNIFE impales itself into the BODYGUARD’S cheek. CHRISTMA then pulls the man’s PISTOL free and FIRES at the fleeing GANG MEMBER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrified GANG MEMBER races into the CROWDED ROOM. TW BODYGUARDS see this and pull out their WEAPONS as the GAN MEMBER stumbles past.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: spots the commotion before EMANUEL does. The TWO BODYGUAR are suddenly blown off their feet by bullets fired by CHRISTMAS who now roars into view. The hysterical CROWD charges toward the front exit. RICHARD lunges forward and grabs the PISTOL of the TABLE BODYGUARD who is now taking aim at CHRISTMAS. RICHARD swi the WEAPON towards EMANUEL who is pulling his PISTOL whil hurling wrathful expletives.  79. With the PISTOL still in the BODYGUARD’S hand, RICHARD fi THREE ROUNDS into EMANUEL, who slumps face forward sendin the array of LIQUOR BOTTLES crashing to the floor. RICHARD pulls the PISTOL free and shoots the TABLE BODYGU point blank then blasts TWO MORE BODYGUARDS away that com him head on. CHRISTMAS dives behind the bar and leaping up, blows the charging BODYGUARD away. With their blood boiling, both RICHARD and CHRISTMAS rapi scan the room for any more ATTACKERS. No threats left, on the chaos of the fleeing PATRONS. But suddenly, the fatally wounded BODYGUARD that CHRISTMA impaled in the face, rumbles into the room with CHRISTMAS KNIFE now raised high for the kill. To avoid hitting CHRISTMAS, RICHARD leaps to the side and fires. But just as the BULLET hits the mark, the startlin visual of KONG appears soaring onto the BODYGUARD’S NECK his LEGS clasped in a vice-like grip. Like a steer wrestler, KONG uses all his momentum and violently somersaults the THUG forward until the man’s NE snaps brutally against the floor. KONG rises and eyes CHRISTMAS.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: ‘Experience Mexico’ CHRISTMAS shrugs and retrieves his knife.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: The weapons okay? KONG nods. CHRISTMAS faces RICHARD who looks agitated.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s go - (they start off) You saved my ass, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (dryly) ...Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL SANDS stands before the CLERK that issued BARNEY ROS his unit. WILL displays his BADGE and PHOTO CREDENTIALS.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You leased a unit to a ‘Michael Averman’ - I need to see it.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Without a warrant, I need two more forms of I.D. - State law. WILL sighs and reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings inward. A thin FILAMENT glued to the top the door starts to pull tight, it’s other end anchored to door frame. WILL slides in through the opening door, and only at the very LAST SECOND does he spot the filament, now nearly TA several inches above his head. Instinctively, he reaches up, to where the filament conne to the door frame. There, it is tied to a GRENADE, which has pulled HALF WAY OUT OF THE TIN CAN that is nailed to door frame. The can, acting as a sheath, holds the grenad STRIKING LEVER in place. WILL grasps the grenade and eases it out of the can. Pull down a long section of FILAMENT. He wraps the GRENADE’S HANDLE safely down and sets it beside the door. Carefully enters the room. Standing in the center of the cold unit, lit only by a dangling bulb, WILL stares at the only object in the unit LARGE TELEVISION SET that sits in the corner. As he runs his fingers across the top of the set, a panel comes loose. WILL lifts the ENTIRE TOP OF THE TV OFF. The television is HOLLOW. Inside is BARNEY’s cardboard DOCUME BOX.  81. Opening the box he sees it’s full of FILES. Judging by th condition/color of the manila tabs, one of them is MUCH N than the others. WILL reaches for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRISTMAS and KONG are unloading the recently acquired WEAPONS. At the far end of the dimly lit room, RICHARD is angrily confronting BARNEY.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You didn’t hire me for what I could do, my skill! - You hired me because you didn’t know the kind of man you were dealing with. Why did you send me there? To distract him? Seduce him? What?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Look, I heard about how this guy ‘is’ and I thought it wouldn’t hurt having somebody on the team who would know how to handle ‘people’ like that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Like it takes one to know one?! We're not from a different planet. I’m the same as you. (gesturing to Kong and Christmas ) And them!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (gestures towards Kong) Maybe him, Mate, not me.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) We needed these weapons - Exactly on time - I didn’t know what to expect from this guy.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Now that you got them, am I finished? You want someone ‘normal’ now?  82.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You're the real deal, Richard, I apologize for keeping you in the dark - Won't happen again.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Good, just remember I’m a soldier first and a fag second, okay?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s easy to follow. RICHARD extends his hand and BARNEY shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kid. CHRISTMAS lowers a CRATE of EXPLOSIVES then he glances ov at RICHARD and BARNEY shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (good-naturedly) Why don’t you two kiss and make up and let a couple of real men finish their work.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Go kick his ass, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: .+-He might like it too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIEF INTELLIGENCE OFFICER MONROE strides through the off ignoring the various greetings and enters her office. INT. MONROE’S OFFICE - DAY MONROE finds herself staring at... ...A LARGE TOPOGRAPHIC MAP OF CORZA tacked to her wall. W looks over his shoulder at MONROE, then returns his gaze the MAP.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: What’re you doing in here?  83.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: That photo I asked you about was taken in Corza.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind? One phone call, that’s all it’1ll take and what’s left of your half-assed career is over. WILL turns to face MONROE.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Could be, be that as it may, I'd like to know what’s so important on that island that would attract you and mercenaries?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: If what you’re looking for is redemption, you’ve definitely stepped into the wrong office.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What’re you talking about? MONROE zero’s in on WILL like a snake facing down her pre

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You know what I’m talking about, Agent - I read your file. It’s sad, very very sad, because at one-time you were actually a functioning part of this agency - Intimate with the way we do and do not do the craft of intelligence, then eight years ago the wheels came off when you were assigned to track down ‘mercenaries’ lead by a man named Ross, ring a bell? It should, then for some insane reason, maybe just inborn ignorance, you let these bastards get away with breaking into not one, but two sanctioned agency detention centers in Poland and Romania and free targeted political detainees, “detention centers” that were sanctioned by the Secretary of Defense himself!  84.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: People were being taken in the middle of the night without any evidence and thrown into a hole for years —

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You're not ‘the good shepherd’ - You failed, Will!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Even the head of this agency condemned it!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: We ‘spun’ it that way because of you! You made Ross the ‘good,’ and us the ‘bad’!? So your career goes down the toilet, the marriage follows and the bottle’s your only drinking buddy. You covered up for a mercenary who couldn’t give a crap about freeing political prisoners, he would've freed Hitler for the right price! So he’s living the high life and you’re in the basement analyzing data no one in this organization really cares about. (softening) You made a mistake, don’t make a second one - Here. MONROE opens her desk drawer and produces a BLACK AND WHI PHOTO. It is an aged long lens PHOTO of a BEARDED MAN in his lat 50’s. She passes it to WILL.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: That’s Hashim Al Tais - You know who he is?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The middle east’s not my expertise.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: He’s one of the high ranking but low profile remaining officers in Al-Qaeda. You asked why we're monitoring Corza - MONROE paces.  85.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: He’s on Corza and using the island, we believe, as a sanctuary to rebuild the organization’s chain of command. Within a year we expect this cell’s potential to pose a serious threat to National Security.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: If you know that then why are you waiting to take him down?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Because we're still gathering information. Corza’s small, a hard place to blend in, so we need to court General Garza, which would allow us to conduct strict surveillance in exchange for political privileges, protection and financial compensation. (beat) We can’t afford anything less than 100% success on this op. WILL is taken aback by this information.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I’m being straight with you - If you know anything of real value and care about this country, you’ll share it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL struggles for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Do you want to be remembered like you are or could be?!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: ...An assassination is being planned.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: By who?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Ross and his men.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Against Al-Tais?  86.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No names are mentioned, but the ‘course of action’ strategy is laid out in detail, I read it myself.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Three days.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Christ - they really don’t have a ‘code’ when it comes to money. Excuse me I have to get on this while there’s still some time. WILL starts towards the door very conflicted, he pauses.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I think I know the best way to stop ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (weakly) We had a similar situation in that part of the world in ‘99.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Corza falls under the operational umbrella of Seal Team One that’s still stationed at the Naval Amphibious Base in Coronado. If the assault team is deployed at least a day before Ross’ group arrives, that’1l be enough time for them to position themselves and remove the mercenaries before your operation with Al-Tais has been compromised.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (lifts her phone) Get me Johnson at N.C.S. (to Will) What you’ve done will be known by the ‘right’ people.  87. WILL admits an exhausted sigh and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN SOLDIERS have assaulted a FARMER who lies beaten to t ground. Begging for mercy, the FARMER’S WIFE states she’s seen SANDRA and frantically points towards her whereabout A SOLDIER heaves a MOLOTOV COCKTAIL at the tiny FARMHOUSE while the other TROOPS quickly pile into the TRUCK. INT. MONROE’S OFFICE - NIGHT MONROE sits behind her cleared desk. A single LIGHT SOURC creates a sinister atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: We've learned that you once worked with this group.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I was part of ‘em - Six years.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Why’‘d you leave, Mr. Jensen?

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s my business.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Yes it is. We now see GUNNAR JENSEN sitting in the darkness. Leaning forward, his lifeless eyes drift out of the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Can you find Ross? Quickly that is.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR JENSEN
dialogues.text: I can find him.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: He’s become a security danger.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Spare the bull shit.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: The compensation is agreeable then?  88. GUNNAR nods almost imperceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (rising) Good. He treated you badly, now it’s only right he gets what he deserves. GUNNAR rises and stares down at her in an intimidating fashion.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: If I didn’t need the money, you'd ‘deserve’ to go before him. With that said GUNNAR steps into the darkness leaving a shaken MONROE in his wake. EXT. GARZA’S PALACE - DUSK An ARMY TRUCK occupied with EIGHT SOLDIERS rumbles throug the gates. PAINE and the other TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES st firm as the vehicle grinds to a halt directly in front of menacing men. SANDRA is roughly pulled into view and thrown to the grou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CELL DOOR is open. TWO GUARDS flank the doorway. Insi SANDRA is bound to a chair. Scared to death, she tries to compose herself. With no warning GARZA appears in the CELL DOORWAY. He cal approaches SANDRA and gazes into the helpless woman’s eye

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (soothingly) Be afraid. GARZA’S expression softens into an almost warm smile, whereupon he savagely BACKHANDS her knocking her unconsci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working under a single light source CHRISTMAS wipes the s that runs down his forehead as he meticulously assembles small but powerful EXPLOSIVE DEVICES. EXT. HALE CAESAR’S RESTAURANT The streets are fairly deserted in front of the colorful eatery.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HALE CAESAR’S In the confines of his office HALE CAESAR toils in front his computer as he’s in the process of gathering DATA on CORZA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the storefront window RICHARD is seen in the rear the PARLOR being tattooed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pans down to RICHARD’S FOREARM. We see a RAVEN perched upon a SKULL being tattooed onto his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL sits at the MID-SCALE BAR. The place is dully lit an this late hour has TEN OTHER CUSTOMERS. WILL motions to t BARTENDER to refill his GLASS. The man appears lost in de thought. His CELL PHONE rings.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Will Sands - that’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Who’s this?  90.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s the agency want with me? The hairs on WILL’S neck rise.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Ross?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why were you going through my property, Will?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I think you know the answer. WILL rises and moves to an ALCOVE near the MEN’S ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How long have you been following me?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Long enough.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We have enough to indict you and your friends.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why would you want to do that?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: The truth? You’re no better than run-of-the-mill murderers.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’s debatable, Willy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY stands in a PUBLIC PHONE BOOTH located in a seedie section of the city... We CROSS-CUT throughout the scene.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Think the world’s getting better or worse?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Answer the question or I'll hang up.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Hang up.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Called my bluff - Again, think the world’s getting better or worse? Humor me.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Worse.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We remove those hard to get at stains, Will.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You’re not making sense.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We kill ‘killers.’

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: For money.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Gotta eat, but all the ‘targets’ have gotten what they deserve - That’s the ‘rule.’

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Now you have ‘rules?’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Only one.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Your distorted ethics aside - What you do is just wrong.  92.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ‘Wrong?’ You mean like working for an agency that arms third world death squads led by insane dictators to overthrow democratically elected governments.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: We have ‘right’ on our side.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You don’t have ‘right,’ you have ‘power.’

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You’re gonna get caught in the middle and get taken out.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: By you?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Man, I’ve helped you more than you know - I used to think most of what you did was right. But you have no code - You work against your own country.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Now you don’t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Maybe this does - Stay away from Corza! I don’t know who’s paying you, but give it back. We’1ll take care of Al-Tais, not you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (slight laugh) You've got to get out more.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Think this is funny?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah - Al-Tais is dead. WILL is speechless.  93.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: He was shot outside of Kabul four days ago by one of my competitors - Listen, Will, choose a side, or move aside. BARNEY hangs up. WILL slowly closes his PHONE as he strug to make sense of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY walks to his truck and enters. KONG is sitting in passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’d you want to talk about?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: My life.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That shouldn't take long. BARNEY fires up the engine and pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high angle shot of BARNEY’S TRUCK driving along the fri of the city.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So what's wrong with your life?

dialogues.speaker: KONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I want a raise.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - NIGHT BARNEY flips on the RADIO to an OLDIES station.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Why do you deserve a raise?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: I been with you longest - I work harder than the others.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What makes you say that?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: They’re taller - Everything is more work for me.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (sighs) C'mon —

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: When I get hurt, the wound is twice as big -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - ‘Cause you’re smaller.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (nods ‘yes’ ) When I travel I have to go farther because -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - You're smaller.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (nods ) And I’m Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: So I’m smarter - Smarter’s worth more.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re getting ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: We’re smarter.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Have highest I.Q. (Barney shakes his head 'No.’) Who’s smarter?  95.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Technically Western Jewish descendants. KONG. Bull shit - Suddenly the rear window of BARNEY'S vehicle shatters and blizzard of tiny glass shards blast through the car. More shots and the front windshield is blown to pieces. BARNEY and KONG whip around and see an SUV charging towar them. BARNEY floors it.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: It’s Gunnar!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Should’ve shot ‘im when I had the chance.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: is behind the wheel of the SUV and is bearing down hard o BARNEY and KONG. BARNEY swings his truck onto an intersec highway and roars towards an older industrial part of the city. The highway is nearly deserted but there are enough vehic present to cause a half dozen near misses as BARNEY and GUNNAR weave through the oncoming cars. All the while, KO and GUNNAR exchange sporadic gunfire. BARNEY tears down a wide alley barely keeping several lan ahead of GUNNAR who manages to get off several shots. In the near distance he spots a FREIGHT TRAIN moving in t opposite direction. He races towards it with GUNNAR in ho pursuit. BARNEY floors it as his truck is getting dangerously clos intersecting the monster FREIGHT TRAIN. The RAILWAY CROSS LIGHTS begin to flash, but BARNEY barrels ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: SUV
dialogues.text: Again, GUNNAR attempts to draw a bead on BARNEY while kee an eye on the freight train, but the road’s too rough to a clean shot.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: BARNEY’S TRUCK Streaks across the TRACKS missing the train by at least 5 YARDS. GUNNAR is also going to make it safely across, but to his horror, he sees BARNEY from the other side of the tracks, whipping the truck into another 180 DEGREE TURN. BARNEY g the PISTOL from KONG and fires headlong at GUNNAR’S SUV.

dialogues.speaker: SUV
dialogues.text: GUNNAR involuntarily SLAMS on the breaks, bringing the SU a skidding stop nearly in the center of the tracks. GUNNAR’S EYES bulge as the immense FREIGHT TRAIN rams int the rear QUARTER PANEL of the SUV, sending it PIN WHEELIN YARDS off the tracks and past BARNEY and KONG, then capsi over an embankment. BARNEY and KONG leap from the truck and charge over the EMBANKMENT. Cautiously moving forward, BARNEY checks the in his PISTOL’S CLIP.

dialogues.speaker: SUV
dialogues.text: With it’s HEADLIGHTS still on, the badly damaged vehicle on it’s side, STEAM pouring from under the hood. BARNEY a KONG approach and notice the driver side door is open. BARNEY motions for KONG to swing wide while he approaches SUV. BARNEY approaches from an angle that permits him to fully inside. Suddenly the GUNSHOTS rip through the silence and the rea passenger window explodes inches away from BARNEY’S HEAD.  97. He dives to the ground as more BULLETS tear into the car’ metal.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: BLOODY and badly shaken up, he puts his pain aside and ru forward. Suddenly BARNEY rolls from his position and FIRE back, but GUNNAR holds his ground and returns FIRE. Sudde the high caliber PISTOL is KICKED from GUNNAR’S hand and falls a short distance away. KONG rushes into view and commences to ferociously attack GUNNAR with all his fury. Completely caught off guard GUN is dazed and staggers against a clump of TREES. KONG goes for the kill, but GUNNAR rises and strikes KONG with an arching back fist delivered by his MASSIVE ARM. Now it’s GUNNAR’S turn to attack.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: flips the door mounted AUTO SEARCHLIGHT into the darkness the BEAM settles on GUNNAR who kicks KONG with such brute force, KONG is sent flying, and collides in a semi-consci state. GUNNAR glares into the stark white BEAM of the AUTO SEARCHLIGHT. BARNEY sees GUNNAR in his sights and is abou shoot.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: No!! He’s mine! KONG attacks GUNNAR who again dominates with his incredib strength and grabs KONG by the throat in a similar fashio the first scene. KONG cracks GUNNAR against the EYE which frees him up. KO now zeroes in on his stunned opponent and proceeds to ral back. Badly weakened by the barrage, GUNNAR’S knees are repeatedly assaulted until the huge man drops to one knee Glinting in the car beam is his PISTOL only a foot from h hands.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (aiming) Gunnar it’s over - Don’t move!!  98. GUNNAR seizes the PISTOL and KONG leaps on him. But in a burst of barbaric strength, kicks KONG aside and trains t PISTOL dead into KONG’S face. BARNEY squeezes off a SHOT and GUNNAR collapses to the ground. KONG glares at his foe and backs off as BARNEY approaches. They pass each other while looking straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: I would've won.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (walking straight past) Maybe. GUNNAR is moments away from death. Blood seeps from a fat CHEST WOUND.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: I tried.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Came close.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: Needed money.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Should've asked me.

dialogues.speaker: GUNNAR
dialogues.text: (soft revelation) Shit - I’m dyin.’

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: - Looks that way - Who hired you, Gunnar? GUNNAR weakly shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You’re not telling. GUNNAR’S eyes indicate he’s remaining silent.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: An asshole to the end. GUNNAR’S eyes slowly shut. He’s moments from death.  99.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You know you’re dying - So what difference will it make - I’d tell you - I'll pay for your funeral and scatter your ashes right before the next battle, fair enough? GUNNAR’S eyes slightly open and his BLOODY HAND weakly ri and seizing BARNEY’S shirt, slowly pulls him forward.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: Leaning against the DAMAGED SUV, the SEARCHLIGHT’S BEAM i directly over his shoulder as he watches the moment betwe BARNEY and GUNNAR play out, then respectfully angles the SEARCHLIGHT to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: INTERROGATION ROOM, (CORZA)
dialogues.text: Shafts of LIGHT manage to seep through the overhead floor SANDRA has taken quite a battering. PAINE observes from t background.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: She says she was paid to show ‘em around - Says she never saw them before.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: She’s lying - You get her family?

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: No, no family - I want her dead.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: No, I’ve secured clearance for a SEAL team to arrive early morning the day after me and I need you to make sure your soldiers are told to stay the hell out of their way. General, I need to find out everything, keep the girl alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE hangs up just as her SECRETARY knocks and enters holding a sealed 8 X 10 MANILA ENVELOPE.  100.

dialogues.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogues.text: This just arrived -

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Leave it. The SECRETARY nods and exits. With her mind still preoccupied, MONROE opens the ENVELOPE and sees a WALLET. Opening the object, her eyes narrow as they come to rest GUNNAR JENSEN’S DRIVER'S LICENSE. Clipped to the back is NOTE. “ONE ACT OF VENGEANCE DESERVES ANOTHER - LOVE, B.” MONROE’S heart sinks.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HALE CAESAR’S — DAWN BARNEY'S team is seated around the empty restaurant enjoy a “hearty” breakfast of left-over Mexican food. HALE CAESAR is flipping through a THICK FOLDER that lies the center of a LARGE TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: In the past six months only four men have flown to Corza with European passports and they’re all with the same company.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Smarter than you look.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: But you’re not.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon, keep going -

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (pained) I can’t eat this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Then don’t, Pinche! Who cares? KONG tosses down a taco and covers it with a PLATE. HALE CAESAR is highly insulted.  101.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Enough.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Don’t like tacos, but eatin’ rats an’ cats is cool?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: We don’t eat cats!!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (raising his fist) Somebody’s going to be eating this. (to Hale Caesar) Go on, damn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE is being driven away when WILL appears and steps i front of her car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER faces MONROE, who’s face is reddening.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (exiting) Stay in the car. WILL approaches MONROE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: What do you want? Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: There’s no Al-Tais, there’s no terrorist cell, there’s nothing! So you tell me, what’s there!? INT. HALE CAESAR’S RESTAURANT - KITCHEN -— DAWN BARNEY is paging through the DATA that HALE CAESAR has compiled.  102.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Renaissance Holdings, LP. It’s this German multinational company out of Munich that deals in shipping, land and -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Oil -

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, oil.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - There it is.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Here’s some pictures of some of the Board of Directors - The Chairman is this dude here, Helmut Ernst, he’s the main man, and the CEO of the whole thing. (hands over a photo) That’s him. BARNEY’S eyes darken as he stares at the photo. HELMUT ER was the German-looking fellow who supposedly was MR. CHUR “BSSISTANT.”

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Christ -

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (picking up another photo) Looks good for a ‘dead’ guy. Check it out. CHRISTMAS hands the PHOTO to BARNEY. It is a picture of t supposedly MURDERED GRANDSON, standing with CHURCH, HELMU ERNST, and several OTHER MEN, now looking quite alive.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A close-up of the PHOTO of CHURCH’s “Grandson” laying murdered in a ditch.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Got a name for him?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: No - Probably some flunky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY angrily tosses the pictures on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE’s face is contorted with anger.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Come on! Open your god damn eyes! What’s the one thing in this world, that our agency would protect to make sure that we’re never at the mercy of any other country? A major find - a couple hundred miles off our shores and you don’t think our government should control that?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: It’s not the government, it’s you using the agency as a front!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You’re an agency ‘turncoat,’ a walking joke, who nobody would ever believe, so stick to chasing bottom feeders like Ross and his losers! No, forget that, thanks to you the ‘Seals’ have other plans for them, so back the fuck off, or it’s over for you too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE turns and re-enters her VEHICLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GROUP

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to driver) Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: CAESAR'S
dialogues.text: is still gathered around the table as BARNEY paces.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: This Church guy was fronting for this ‘Renaissance’ Company ‘cause they were in with the last president. But the agency must have caught wind of what was goin’ down on Corza and backed a coup with Garza, who they’re controllin’. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HALE CAESAR (cont'd) So how does Renaissance get back on track? Have us wack Garza, throw the place into chaos, then these shitheads come back in and pick up where they left off -

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Do? We’re ready - We should go.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: I say hell with it - They’re all thieves, let ‘em kill themselves off. Why we going and maybe get shot up?!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ‘Cause we’re paid to go!

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ‘Cause some girl you’re feeling sorry for?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Then stay back.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Yo, any man willin’ to get killed for some bitch he ain’t known for one damn day is ignorant!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (standing) Don’t call me ignorant!

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (rising) Then don’t make me get ‘ignorant’ on your ass!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hey, both of you, back off! - (to Caesar) You out or in?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: And have all you all talkin’ insultin’ shit about me? (to Christmas) She better be fine.  105. CAESAR extends his fist and CHRISTMAS bumps it in a gestu of camaraderie.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: She’s not bad.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: .-.-Let’s go to war.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. WILL’S OFFICE - NIGHT The MAN is slumped behind his DESK. Though his body langu appears lifeless, his EYES are incredibly alive. Hundreds thoughts race through his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PLANE is dock side. RICHARD, HALE CAESAR, and KONG ar loading the large craft with CRATES of WEAPONS. CHRISTMAS guides a HAND TRUCK with what appears to be a large defla ZODIAC RAFT.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Somebody gimme a hand with this!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: is seated in the COCKPIT. He is presently on the PHONE. Through the cockpit WINDOWS, we see the MEN below loading aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: If we don’t have the palace secured by 05:00 hour, we’re dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHURCH is being driven by the YOUNG MAN, BILL, who was se as the FAKE DEAD GRANDSON in the photo. Seated in the rea CHURCH and his boss, HELMUT ERNST.  106.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: If we do, you can land there by 5:15.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Alright - Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY is seated in the COCKPIT.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: There’s one thing -

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: The full amount’s got to be doubled and split between the account numbers that you received - This isn’t negotiable.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Why double?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Take it or leave it.

dialogues.speaker: MAYBACH BENZ
dialogues.text: CHURCH covers the MOUTHPIECE and faces HELMUT ERNST.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: He wants double to continue. HELMUT’S lips tighten. Then almost imperceptibly he nods consent.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: Alright - Done.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: For your grandson.  107.

dialogues.speaker: CHURCH
dialogues.text: ..-Yes. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: WILL’S OFFICE - NIGHT Still immersed in thought, WILL’S expression begins to co to life. His EYES denote a revelation. Energized, he bolt upright and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moonlight the commanding SEAPLANE glides gracefull above the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rear compartment, RICHARD, HALE CAESAR, and KONG s among the CARGO, each lost in their own thoughts. BARNEY and CHRISTMAS are in the COCKPIT.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Think she’s alive?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: .-.-Don’t know - It’s true what Caesar said, you barely know this woman.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That’s not the point.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: What’s ‘the point’?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: The point is being where you’re needed, even if you’re not asked to be there, because it’s the right thing to do.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: So you’re doing it for yourself.  108.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Don’t complicate it, okay? BARNEY pulls out a BOX of ASHES then opens the side COCKP WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: What’re you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Spreading Gunnar - I promised him.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: .+-You just poisoned about a hundred whales. BARNEY shrugs and pulls out a FIFTH of BOURBON and takes slug. He passes it to CHRISTMAS who does likewise. This i standard ritual before going to battle. CHRISTMAS rises and faces the other MEN.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Kong. KONG steps forward and taking the BOTTLE, drinks then pas it to HALE CAESAR, who does likewise then RICHARD.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: “,...Do all the good we can, by all the means we can...” The MEN join in.

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE
dialogues.text: “In all the ways we can...In all the places we can...To all the people we can...For we will never pass this way again...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL is on fire as LICKSON keeps pace with him.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: If there was a chance the agency was involved, Ross knew which team we'd send because he was a C.O. with Seal Team One for ten years - Jesus! How'd I overlook that? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILL (cont'd) And that alias he used at the storage house with the fake attack data was planted, he wanted it found!

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: I got a hold on a company jet.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I set him up -

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: - It’s alright, we’ll be there before he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL GROUP OF HEAVILY ARMED NAVY SEALS peer into the n with their NIGHT VISION GOGGLES (NVGs).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way in the distance, CORZA slowly comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the ZODIAC drifts to a silent landing, the SEAL team l out and moves quickly inland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With MILITARY ISSUE HATS pulled low and wearing full CAMM MAKE-UP, the SEALS glide up the silent streets. Rounding the corner they come upon a group of SOLDIERS. T SOLDIERS grip their weapons. The SEALS prepare to battle.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) They’re the ones they told us were coming. The LEAD SOLDIER waves them on.  110. EXT. PRESIDENTIAL PALACE —- NIGHT The powerful presence of PAINE moves down the shadowy hallway, and arrives at a DOUBLE-DOOR ENTRANCE flanked by GUARDS. The guards stand aside as he rumbles past. INT. GARZA’S OFFICE - NIGHT The door opens. We see the arrogant body language of GENE GARZA, as he nervously paces while puffing on a CIGAR. SA is seated in a chair, HANDS BOUND. Her face is BRUISED an her nose is BLEEDING.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I understand what you’re going through, but knowing this man, it'll get worse - It’s the General’s call. The General’s the one who’s at risk, and wants you ‘gone.’ That’s wrong, no one should be tortured unless they’re lying, and truthfully I think you are Sandra - I need the truth or I can’t help you.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: .-.I know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (entering) The SEALS are here. GARZA glances over at MONROE, who is flushed with supreme confidence.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (sips brandy) All is good, General. MONROE gestures to PAINE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (indicating Sandra) We'll finish with her later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FIVE SEALS are seen jogging to the PALACE, which loom the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANDRA is pulled roughly by a pair of GUARDS, who fling h into a DARK CELL. The METAL DOOR slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA’S eyes reveal great agitation, but his slow gesture are unsettling to MONROE.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: They will stop these men who come to kill me - You know this?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: They’1l be ‘removed’, yes -

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: If not, you will be -

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (patiently) When you threaten me, you threaten the whole agency - That is not good business, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALS arrive at the towering gates, which are flanked two GUARD TOWERS. As the gates begin to grind open, we no see clearly the ‘SEALS’ are BARNEY, CHRISTMAS, RICHARD, K and HALE CAESAR. The GATE continues opening, revealing a CLUSTER OF CURIOU SOLDIERS. As the gates FULLY open, our boys behold a HUNDRED AND FI soldiers spread out before them. BARNEY eyes ADDITIONAL SOLDIERS on walls. BARNEY gestures to CHRISTMAS then eyes the base of the gu tower rising beside CHRISTMAS.  112. The SOLDIERS part as PAINE and the other TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES approach.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Dan Paine, Head of General Garza’s security detail. Even though PAINE has seen a picture of BARNEY before, th uniform and DARK CAMMO make-up make identification impossible.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (stepping forward) Sir, you aware of our orders?

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (nods ) Yeah - just take these Assholes out.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Where’s the General now?

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (gestures) His private quarters. He’ll be there until this is over. PAINE points to the highest balcony where they see GENERA GARZA’S outline standing at the railing. GARZA’S cigar sm drifts like a ghost in the dead night air. The FAINT FIGU of MONROE is seen standing off to the side.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: We need to inspect the ‘kill zone’ from every vantage point.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (tersely) A couple of these monkeys will show you around - Report back to me when your done. CHRISTMAS subtly places a SMALL RADIO DETONATE CHARGE on inside leg of the GUARD TOWER as they move off. INT. PALACE (GARZA’S CHAMBERS) - NIGHT Sipping whiskey, GENERAL GARZA gazes at the PHOTO of hims It depicts Garza atop a makeshift stage, addressing a lar crowd in the center of the city. On both sides of him are heavily armed SOLDIERS.  113.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (distantly) .+-How long before the fight begins?

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Within 24 hours give or take, but it won’t be a fight, General. Everything's under control. GARZA stares blankly into space - The man’s fucking nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY, KONG, CHRISTMAS, HALE CAESAR and RICHARD move pas SOLDIERS’ BARRACKS, which are nothing more than row after of TATTERED TENTS and DILAPIDATED SHACKS. The hefty guide SERGEANT GOMEZ, dully gestures toward the area.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) ..-This is where we all sleep - Over there we grow food.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Is this guy stupid?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (stepping away) Looks that way. The SARGENT takes offense as RICHARD translates.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Tell this idiot to move his ass or I’1ll kick his ass! They start to move off, but the sound of a SLAMMING DOOR attracts their attention. HALE CAESAR steps to a large GR in the ground, and looks down.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Check it out. The MEN cross over. Looking at least 15 feet down, they s JAIL GUARD lighting a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (anxiously) See anyone?  114.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Too dark.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GOMEZ
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) It’s nothing! Come on! (inflamed, to Christmas) And you! I don’t like the way you talk like shit to me, I ama Sargent - A BLUR passes in front of the SERGEANT’S face as KONG kic the chunky slob in the jaw. The man collapses in an inglorious heap.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (gestures toward Kong) Broke his neck. KONG shrugs as BARNEY, HALE CAESAR and RICHARD drag the SERGEANT into a corner of the palace.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Check watches - 3:36 - All good? Glancing at their WATCHES, they all nod in unison.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: 20 minutes to slice this place up - You all know your sectors - Now hit it fast and hard; good luck. KONG, HALE CAESAR and BARNEY start to move off, RICHARD pauses and feels for the Sergeant’s pulse. There is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pockets of SOLDIERS form themselves into groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of GUARDS are stationed at the end of a long corri KONG comes into view. His SILHOUETTE is seen dashing acro the hallway past the slumping guards...He places another RADIO ACTIVATED CHARGE against a SUPPORT COLUMN, then gracefully disappears.

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT
dialogues.text: HALE CAESAR enters a pitch black room and flips on his MI FLASHLIGHT. Placing an EXPLOSIVE next to several large we worn GENERATORS, he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA’S CHAMBER The demented soul is pacing to and fro, as his anxiety mounts. More DRINKING. MONROE shines her WRISTWATCH, just biding her time.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY
dialogues.text: RICHARD plants a rigged charge against an ARCHWAY.

dialogues.speaker: KONG.
dialogues.text: On the second floor, he places an EXPLOSIVE in another strategic locale.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: A pair of GUARDS move down the dim hallway on the third floor. A FOOT flies out of the doorway knocking one guard cold. CHRISTMAS sweeps the second GUARD off his feet and him to sleep with an elbow to the forehead. He places an EXPLOSIVE and splits.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Now in the basement, we see by the glow of his MINI- FLASHLIGHT the placing of a TIMED CHARGE next to BARRELS FUEL.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: passes the doorway to an open office, and though dimly li sees a GUARD taking a leak from the second story window. Smash cut of an elbow to the side of the head. The GUARD drops while still in the act of relieving himself. HALE CAESAR slaps a rigged charge on the wall and exits.

dialogues.speaker: KONG.
dialogues.text: moves cautiously down the hall. Behind a door, he hears h footsteps approaching. With cat-like agility, he leaps on large wooden hallway CHAIR, then bounds up to an overhead BEAM. A split second later, PAINE and the TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES exit, passing directly beneath KONG. He places charge on the BEAM and drops from view.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: slips down the hallway, approaching GENERAL GARZA’S Chamb as he prepares to take out the two SENTRIES. PAINE and th TWO AMERICAN OPERATIVES turn the corner. CHRISTMAS slips into an ADJOINING ROOM as the behemoths p Without hesitation, he places a CHARGE at the base of the wall, and exits out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: plants a charge against another portion of the palace’s FOUNDATION. Checking his WATCH, he bolts off with a heightened sense of purpose.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: is balanced precariously on a ledge overlooking a hundred fifty SOLDIERS below. He starts to glide away when GENERA GARZA’S enraged voice stops him cold.  117.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: ..-It is your job, your work to know these things! Who wants to kill me!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyeing the nearest WINDOW, he crosses the eight foot span LEAPS just as the BALCONY DOORS violently swing open and GENERAL GARZA charges into view.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: still being carried by the momentum of his leap, rolls to feet just as a GUARD holding a FLASHLIGHT opens the door. The LIGHT BEAM catches CHRISTMAS dead center, but without much as a nanosecond of hesitation, he whips out his THRO KNIFE.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: glides down the dark stone corridor. He pauses. In the distance, he sees the glow of a CIGARETTE belonging to a guard sitting in front of the dank cell occupied by the former President, MIGUEL FUENTES.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA'S CHAMBERS -— BALCONY The GENERAL'S eyes are clouded over. PAINE and the TWO OPERATIVES just stare at the unpredictable dictator.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: Your government tries to trick me and take it all!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: Not true, General.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: You are stupid - Maybe the people hired these men to kill me - They want their old leader back!? You said “Don’t kill him, don’t make him a martyr!” (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GARZA (cont'd) (to Paine) Bring the woman back here now! She knows who is doing this! Bring her now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MONROE realizes rational thought with GARZA is out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Paine) Get her.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT GOMEZ
dialogues.text: is still slumped in his deceased mode. A pair of PALACE SOLDIERS discover the BODY.

dialogues.speaker: CELL GUARD
dialogues.text: A SILENCED SHOT blows the GUARD off his chair.

dialogues.speaker: CELL DOOR
dialogues.text: swings open and the emaciated ex-president, MIGUEL FUENTE terrified by the feral image of BARNEY in full battle ATT

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (smoothly) Miguel Fuentes?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Come with me - BARNEY quickly pulls MIGUEL forward. He gestures to a nea CELL.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: There is another here -  119. BARNEY unlocks the CELL DOOR, sees it’s SANDRA and pulls upright. Looking into BARNEY’S menacing camouflaged face, is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) No! Who are you!?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You know me - Let’s move.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: C’mon! BARNEY leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: COASTLINE
dialogues.text: THREE NAVY SEAL ZODIACS traverse silently through the moonlight water. In the distance, a few faint LIGHTS from city appear against BLACK TERRAIN.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE BASEMENT HALLWAY
dialogues.text: BARNEY, MIGUEL and SANDRA move down a large tunnel, which dully lit by several LOW WATT hanging bulbs. Suddenly BARNEY is blind-sided by the butt of a black AX HANDLE, and drops. PAINE steps from his concealment behin ALCOVE. MIGUEL and SANDRA turn to flee, but slam into OPERATIVES #1 and #2.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Pull him up!! OPERATIVE #2 grabs the dazed BARNEY in a lethal choke hol and yanks him upright. PAINE roughly wipes the cammo make-up off BARNEY’S face.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!
RICHARD, HALE CAESAR, KONG and CHRISTMAS have dropped to knee. Their anxiety mounting.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Times up - What’s your call?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: We're goin’ back in - Give us 10 minutes - If we’re not back, try to save your own ass. They bolt off as HALE CAESAR checks his WATCH.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: His fists slam into Barney’s mid-section with colossal fo followed by a blow to the jaw that buckles his knees.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Who hired you?! PAINE blasts him again.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Give me answers now, or you’re dyin,’ right here! Another BODY BLOW sags BARNEY'S knees. Glancing up, he se movement through the OVERHEAD GRATE. It’s CHRISTMAS and K

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: (fist clenched) Who hired you!? I will pull you inside out! Who?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper) You’re mother. Enraged, PAINE draws back his CLUB for the kill shot. KON drops through the overhead GRATE and brutally sidekicks P against the head. PAINE crumbles to one knee, then KONG n AMERICAN OPERATIVE #2. CHRISTMAS drops down next, slamming a potent heel kick in OPERATIVE #3's midsection.  121.

dialogues.speaker: FLOW BATTLE. TO DESCRIBE THE ACTION DESIGNED FOR THIS SCE
dialogues.text: WOULD TAKE MANY PAGES, SO TRUST ME, IT’LL BE LIKE NOTHING SEEN BEFORE. Just when this extraordinary battle scene appears over, a band of TEN SOLDIERS charge into the cavernous corridor. instantly OPEN FIRE. Lethal chunks of MORTAR and STONE are ripped from the wal as the torrent of bullets rain down on OUR BOYS. PAINE and the OPERATIVES hug the floor for dear life. BARNEY pulls MIGUEL FUENTES out of the line of fire. CHRISTMAS pulls SANDRA into a RECESS in the cement wall, whips out his NINE MILLIMETER and returns fire, but takes SLUG in the forearm. His PISTOL drops to the ground. But, a brazen act of bravery, SANDRA drops low and retrieves h PISTOL. Flushed with confidence, the SOLDIERS move boldly toward their pinned victims.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (putting in a fresh clip) Ready?

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (pistol up) - Ready -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (pistol up) -Now! Totally prepared to die in a blaze of glory, BARNEY, KONG CHRISTMAS swing into the line of fire. Suddenly the BLAST of supremely SUPERIOR GUNFIRE roars do the CORRIDOR and Garza’s SOLDIERS are torn to shreds. With their WEAPONS still smoking, RICHARD and HALE CAESAR step into view.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Drop!! RICHARD and HALE CAESAR are completely caught off guard b SIX OTHER SOLDIERS who charge into view.  122. As they hit the ground, CHRISTMAS, KONG and BARNEY unload their WEAPONS on the SQUAD of SOLDIERS, dropping them all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The THREE NAVY SEAL ZODIACS have now landed. The LEAD SERGEANT is stopped dead by the sight of a FOURTH ZODIAC short distance away. He pulls off his NVGs.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What’s that? He calls out to his SQUAD LEADER.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Captain, you see this!? The SEAL CAPTAIN angles through his men. It’s HULKING MAR The SERGEANT touches the SEAL insignia on the ‘STRANGE’ ZODIAC. HULKING MARK flips down his NIGHT VISION GOGGLES. Scrawle the Zodiac side is: “The early bird gets the country.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNEY, KONG, CHRISTMAS, RICHARD, MIGUEL FUENTES and SAND race toward a thick peeling wooden door located at the en the hallway. With PAINE and the TWO OPERATIVES’ hands bound behind the backs with PLASTIC CUFFS, they are shoved along by HALE CAESAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy OAK DOOR swings open onto the PALACE COURTYARD the men pour out into the darkness. Suddenly the men are hit flush with THREE intense SPOTLIG

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (low to Sandra and Miguel) ...-Move away from us. As SANDRA and MIGUEL step to the side, a hundred SOLDIERS step out from the darkness behind the huge spotlights.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE BALCONY
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA savors the visual of his enemies captured below. MONROE nervously paces in the background.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Drop the weapons or you will be killed now!!

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (translating) ..-Drop the weapons or he’1ll kill us.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: That’s original.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY AND GROUP
dialogues.text: scan the area looking for survival options. There are non

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: GARZA’S BALCONY

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Garza) They’re finished - My men will take it from here.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (ignoring Monroe) Three seconds to drop your weapons or die!! Our heroes remain defiant. PAINE is beginning to panic.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: He’1l1 kill all of us!!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nobody cares about you, Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: - It’s way too public.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (ignoring her)

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: Drop the weapons!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (fighting panic) Let me handle the situation!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: - Two! -—

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: - The world press will hear about this you stupid son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: - Three!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: BARNEY ’S fingers unfold. A REMOTE SWITCH is revealed in his palm. flicks a secondary SWITCH and a tiny RED LIGHT appears. CHRISTMAS sees this, who nods to KONG, who also spots the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barney’s thumb presses the IGNITION button. The PALACE ERUPTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real NAVY SEALS are double timing it up to the palace when they’re startled by the tremendous explosions.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE EXPLOSIONS
dialogues.text: The PALACE is being blown up in SECTIONS. Tons of mortar CRUMBLE straight down into smoking piles of RUBBLE.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPENDABLES
dialogues.text: charge into action and commence to unleashing all their f power on the ENEMY.

dialogues.speaker: EXPLOSIONS
dialogues.text: Behind the attacking ‘EXPENDABLES’ we see the PALACE bein literally dissected by surgical-like detonations.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: cuts down THREE SOLDIERS as he sprints for cover behind arches along the COURTYARD WALL. TWO OTHER SOLDIERS flank him, but are blasted away by KONG.

dialogues.speaker: KONG.
dialogues.text: aims high along the COURTYARD and picks off a PAIR of SOLDIERS that crumble into the curled BARBED WIRE.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: rolls beneath the TROOP TRUCK and fires at a GROUP of SOLDIERS who are using the vehicle for cover. FOUR TROOPS drop to the ground in agony. CHRISTMAS pulls the pin on a GRENADE and rolls away from the TRUCK, which explodes sky high landing on TWO fleeing SOLDIERS.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: shoots out TWO of the HUGE SPOTLIGHTS. Now the COURTYARD nearly enveloped in darkness.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: stands beside the large remaining SPOTLIGHT and turns it GROUP of SOLDIERS firing out of the shadows. They fire at HALE CAESAR shattering the light. Returning fire, he kill two.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE
dialogues.text: The structure continues to implode as the lethal charges continue to erupt.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: kills ONE SOLDIER who tries to flank him, RICHARD kills ANOTHER that HALE CAESAR has in his sights.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA AND MONROE
dialogues.text: cower as the EXPLOSIONS approach them from OPPOSITE ends the doomed palace.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: are caught in a crossfire set up by KONG, CHRISTMAS and H CAESAR.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: heaves a grenade at the FRONT GATES, blowing them open.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: he riddles the GUARD TOWER with AUTOMATIC FIRE, blowing T SOLDIERS over the side and onto a BURNING TRUCK.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA AND FUENTES
dialogues.text: Remain huddled behind smoldering debris.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Blasts TWO SOLDIERS, one of which crashes headlong into t FOUNTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: ducking behind a corner in the courtyard wall, he spins around and catches TWO SOLDIERS by surprise and plugs the both with his .45.

dialogues.speaker: GATES
dialogues.text: A GROUP of beaten, terrified and cowardly SOLDIERS flee through the damaged GATES.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: has managed to free his hands and snatches up a DEAD SOLDIER’S WEAPON.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: FOUR SOLDIERS are heading toward the GATE when KONG jumps with a .45 in each hand. Using his amazing kicking abilit coupled with the .45’s, in what seems no more than a spli second, FOUR SOLDIERS are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ‘agency’ LEARJET is 50 feet above the pathetic runway. Below, several soldiers sprint across the tarmac, heading towards the chaos playing out at the palace.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. -— PLANE WILL and LICKSON stare in dismay at the burning PALACE th glows in the distance.  129.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (to pilot) -+-Christ -

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: watches as MORTAR explodes next to his head. Dropping to knee, he sees PAINE approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: ducks behind a STONE STRUCTURE.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: C’mon - Let’s finish this!! PAINE fires at BARNEY, who fires back.

dialogues.speaker: PAINE
dialogues.text: C’mon, man to man! BARNEY heaves an object at PAINE. PAINE hears a THUD at h feet. Looking down at the ROUND OBJECT, his eyes widen in sheer panic as the OBJECT EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: stepping forward.
