dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...-Man to grenade.

dialogues.speaker: TOWN
dialogues.text: Many of the city’s inhabitants dash from their homes and towards the blazing palace.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA AND MONROE
dialogues.text: Traumatized, they gaze numbly at the destruction below.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPENDABLES
dialogues.text: BARNEY, CHRISTMAS, KONG, HALE CAESAR and RICHARD step fro their battle positions.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: goes to SANDRA and helps her up. RICHARD assists MIGUEL FUENTES.

dialogues.speaker: PALACE TOWER
dialogues.text: BARNEY notices a FIGURE standing next to GARZA. He faces of the BOUND AMERICAN OPERATIVES.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ..-Who’s that with Garza?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN OPERATIVE
dialogues.text: Her name’s Monroe. BARNEY'S expression tightens.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL GARZA AND MONROE
dialogues.text: They helplessly stare down SEVEN STORIES below. MONROE crosses to a jagged LEDGE and stiffens at the sight of a growing mob of citizens arriving.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS AND RICHARD
dialogues.text: step forward with SANDRA and FUENTES. CHRISTMAS glances u GARZA’S barely upright TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: - How'd we miss that?

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (to Barney) ...Thank you from myself and these people. CHRISTMAS tightens the tourniquet on his wounded arm. SAN applies pressure. KONG looks unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: - Suck it up. HALE CAESAR wipes the sweat from his forehead. He nods towards SANDRA.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (coyly) . . ...-How’re you this evening, Mam? A DEEP VOICE is heard off screen.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: What the hell!? BARNEY and the team swivel around.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: You were the target?!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: Did you know we were coming? How’d you know we’d be sent in 24 hours early? How?  132.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Just did.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: But you couldn’t know for sure you'd beat us here. How the hell did you know our ETA!? BARNEY glances at RICHARD.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We always trained to hit our targets at 5 AM.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: EXT. BARNEY’S TRUCK - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: NAVY SEAL BASE
dialogues.text: BARNEY and HULKING MARK

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I want someone you’ve worked with directly. Someone you've seen operate.

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: - I got the guy -

dialogues.speaker: HULKING MARK
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: WILL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What happened here? What’d you do? BARNEY turns and sees WILL arriving with LICKSON.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: Who the hell’s he?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: We go way back.  133.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: You’re on foreign soil - illegally. There’s a mandate making all of you subject to criminal arrest.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: You have no jurisdiction over here.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: (to Will) He’s right - Only on American soil.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (to Will) You want to bring somebody in - a guy named Church and his friend, a German named Helmut Ernst, ‘oil boys’ - He hired us to overthrow the General and take over themselves - Might have a case there.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Where’s the proof? BARNEY withdraws a MICRO-RECORDER and presses the PLAY BUTTON.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDER
dialogues.text: (Church’s voice) “,..I want General Garza assassinated, I want his palace leveled -” (clicks it off)

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Kind of flimsy, but it’s a start - They’1l probably be at the airfield in about 15 minutes. We hear MONROE’S voice calling out.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: If anyone can hear this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL GARZA’S BALCONY

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I’m not part of this - I’m an American Government Official.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Is that Monroe?

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA AND MONROE
dialogues.text: On the crumbling PALACE TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (to Garza) Say something for Christ’s sake! GARZA steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: GARZA
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) Everyone - You know me! I am one of you! One of the people who loves this country, loves this land, and will die before I will allow the corrupt government of the United States to enslave our people, like this woman next to me who is trying to steal our country!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I understand Spanish, Bastard!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, SANDRA AND CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: BARNEY glances over at SANDRA’S very bruised face.  SANDRA is 135.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Sandra - What do you want to do with Garza? at a loss for words.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: He should be tried by the people.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: I’m talking to her, Presidente.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: (to Barney) Seriously, I have a hole in my arm.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Almost done.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: There’s a high ranking agency official standing next to Garza - Think this through.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Okay. (to Sandra) Want to blow Garza up? You earned it.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: What you’1ll do is leave them both alive!! That’s what you’1l do! I’1l1 bring Monroe down for this!

dialogues.speaker: MONROE AND GARZA
dialogues.text: MONROE is enraged and steps to the edge of the CRUMBLING TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I know there are American soldiers out there, as well as mercenaries who are here illegally and will be dealt with - I’m being held here against my will!! I need the SEALS to come forward and take me into protective custody now!

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY, WILL AND LICKSON
dialogues.text: They observe MONROE yelling in the background.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: They’11l both be prosecuted back in the states.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: That’1l never happen, Young lady, but I’1l leave it up to you both - Fair enough?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: ...Deal. BARNEY extends his hand. Though hesitant, WILL extends hi and they SHAKE.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You have the right and responsibility to escort me -

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP: BARNEY AND WILL’S HANDS Unknowing, WILL squeezes the DETONATOR resting in BARNEY' palm.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: (continuing) - Safely back to the United States without any further-

dialogues.speaker: BOOOM
dialogues.text: A GIGANTIC EXPLOSION rips the bottom of the TOWER apart, sending it thundering down on MONROE and GARZA.

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: ...Guess we’re done here.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: MIGUEL
dialogues.text: (to Barney) We wanted to turn him over to the people.  137.

dialogues.speaker: KONG
dialogues.text: (walking past) Better get a mop.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Did he just blow up a “high ranking agency official.”

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Apparently.

dialogues.speaker: LICKSON
dialogues.text: (moves off) I‘1l be waiting in the plane. WILL exhales heavily while idly removing his glasses, whi he slowly wipes clean with the bottom portion of his tie.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: They’1l bury it like everything else - Take care, Will. WILL nods and stares at the crumbled TOWER.

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: ...Yeah. BARNEY hands SANDRA a SLIP OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Follow the instructions, there’s enough in the account to get things around here going. BARNEY hugs SANDRA then faces MIGUEL FUENTES.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Hey, watch who you do business with. (walks off)

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Why’d you come back?

dialogues.speaker: HALE CAESAR
dialogues.text: (passing by) ‘Cause you got ‘face,’ Baby, if you were ugly, you'd be dead.  138.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Ignore the black guy.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: You are ‘tonto.’ It was foolish to come back.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: No it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: Where’re you going now?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Home - Here, put this on - CHRISTMAS pulls out the THREE CARAT RUBY RING that he had bought for LACY.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Good - It fits.

dialogues.speaker: SANDRA
dialogues.text: But what does this mean?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: Nothing really - Maybe you’1l be nicer next time I come to visit - Take care, Sandra. She hugs then kisses CHRISTMAS and he jogs up to the departing TEAM and together THE EXPENDABLES walk away fro the PALACE that SMOLDERS in the background until they disappear into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. HALE CAESAR’S - NIGHT It’s late when BARNEY exits. Moving toward his TRUCK that parked out front, he hears his name called.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: ...Barney. Turning, BARNEY observes a familiar presence approaching.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Tracking me again?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: No - Nothing like that.  139.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Any fallout over Monroe?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) .-+.They buried it.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: (nods ) You retire?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: Quit - How’s business these days?

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: Something on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: I don’t know - I’ve got a lot of time on my hands. BARNEY smiles and WILL returns the gesture.

dialogues.speaker: BARNEY
dialogues.text: ...Let’s walk and talk, Will. The CAMERA cranes up as the one time adversaries meander into the balmy night.
